dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is sunset. We drift through the clouds, approaching NU FOUR, PRIVET DRIVE. We sail over the roof of NUMBER FOUR continue on past it into the street. We drift down into an abandoned playground. A lone figure sits on the only unbroken swing.. It is HARRY POTTER. He appears deep in thought. Had he been watching more carefully, he would have seen t old MRS. FIGG watching him from her front porch. MRS. FIGG adjusts her porch chair in order to watch Harry better. The sound of harsh laughter reaches Harry's ears. He look up. Dudley and his gang of followers are walking down the street, telling crude jokes and laughing. They ignore Harry and continue on out of sight. Harry get his feet and follows them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry rounds the corner, only to find himself surrounded Dudley's gang.

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, it's you.

dialogues.speaker: GANG THUG
dialogues.text: What should we do with him, Big D? Harry laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Big D? Cool name, but to me, you'll always be Ikkle Duddicums.

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: Shut up! One of Dudley's gang steps in as if to punch Harry. Harry glares at him. The gang member pauses, then steps back again.

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: Ooo, tough guy. Not so tough in your bed, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MRS. FIGG stands up and goes to the edge of her porch.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FIGG
dialogues.text: You boys go home now, or I'll be calling your parents! They pause and edge away from Harry.

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: I heard you talking in your sleep, last night. Crying. "No, don't kill Cedric, don't kill Cedric! Dad, help me, heeelp me! He's going to kill me! Boo-hoo!" Dudley's gang laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Shut up, Dudley. I'm warning you...

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: Why should I? Harry whips out his wand and points it at Dudley.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Because if you don't I'll turn you into the idiot pig you are! Dudley's gang laughs at Harry. Dudley, on the other hand, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: (terrified) Don't point that thing at me!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Not so brave now, are you Duddykins? Now tell your little friends to go away. Dudley quivers, then finally complies.

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: G-go home!

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! Suddenly nervous, they turn and edge away, soon vanishing into the night. Harry tightened his grip on his wand, glaring fourteen ye of hatred and rage at Dudley.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (cont. ) Don't you ever speak about that again. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: Don't point that thing at me!

dialogues.speaker: I SAID, DO YOU UNDERSTAND
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a cold wind blows through the street, causing everyone to shiver. Harry exhales and his breath is tinge with frost. The street lights flicker, die, and frost over. Dudley is turning in a circle, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Quiet! The stars go out, plunging them into darkness. Dudley yells in fear. Harry turns to the end of the street. Gliding as smooth a death over the street, tattered robes drifting in the win comes a DEMENTOR.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dudley! Run! He turns, grabs his cousin by the arm and drags him down alleyway. Beyond the mouth of the alleyway is the next street, and Number Four, Privet Drive.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Come on! They break into a run. A dementor drifts into the alleyw front of them. Skidding to a stop, Harry turns around, to find the other dementor cutting off the way back. Harry spots a fire escape ladder, leading onto the roof o the house. He taps Dudley on the back, and starts to point to it, wh Dudley turns and punches Harry in the jaw. Dazed, Harry stumbles backwards and falls to his back. His glasses sli from his face. His wand clatters away from him. Crying, Dudley runs away from Harry, towards the first dementor.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dudley, no! Harry feels the ground for his glasses but cannot find th His hands scrabble on the ground in desperation.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lumos ! Three feet away from him, his wand lights up. Harry snatc it up and turns. The dementor closes the distance to Harry swiftly, and is suddenly right before him. Harry raises his wand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: 'Expecto Patronum!' A wisp of misty light protrudes from the tip of his wand, not enough. Harry stiffens and gasps. The dementor closes in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bow to death, Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haaaaaaaarry!... Harry falls onto his back, and the dementor closes the distance. Dudley SCREAMS in the black. Harry glances at him.  Dudley is on his back, hands pulled apart by the other dementor, and the great cloaked head lowering to deliver kiss. Harry raises his wand in desperation.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ‘EXPECTO PATRONUM!' There is a blinding explosion of light as Harry's PATRONO bursts forth, blasting the dementor backwards and away. The light INTENSIFIES, PULSATING from Harry’s wand, expan to fill the alley with wave after pulsing wave of PURE LI The dementors flee. The stars, and street lamps flicker to life again. Dudley lays on the ground, whimpering and shaking. FOOTSTEPS from behind Harry. He turns, wand at the ready, see UNCLE VERNON and AUNT PETUNIA running up to him. He starts to lower it. But they are staring dumbfounded into the sky, watching t Dementors soar away.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: What the hell are those?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dementors. Petunia kneels on the ground next to Dudley.

dialogues.speaker: PETUNIA
dialogues.text: What happened, Duddikins? Vernon turns on Harry, who hastily lowers his wand.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: What the hell is a dementoid? Petunia seizes Dudley and attempts to look into his mouth

dialogues.speaker: PETUNIA
dialogues.text: They didn't--?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. Vernon shoves a large finger at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want some answers!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We were attacked.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: By those...things?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: They’re evil. If they get the chance, they'll suck your soul out through your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: PETUNIA
dialogues.text: They guard the wizard prison, Azkaban. Vernon and Harry look dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: How do you know that? Petunia shakes her head, looking panicky. Vernon helps Dudley unsteadily to his feet, patting him o the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Fought 'em off, eh, Dud? Gave ‘em the ol' one-two?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You can't give a Dementor the 'ol one-two.'

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Why is he all right then?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Because I used magic to save his life! The street-lights die, plunging the street into darkness. Several cloaked people appear around them on the street. Dursleys yell in surprise. They move closer. Harry stands, brandishing his wand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lumos !  Ten wizards stand around them, wands out. Mad-eye Moody, Remus Lupin, Nymphadora Tonks, Kingsley Shacklebolt, Elph Doge, Dedalus Diggle, Emmeline Vance, Sturgis Podmore, an Hestia Jones.

dialogues.speaker: VERNON
dialogues.text: Who are all you lot?

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Quiet, Dursley.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Harry, douse the light. We're exposed here.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (nodding) Nox. Darkness returns to the street, which is now lit only by light of the moon.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: We're your advanced guard, Harry. Dumbledore just sent us as soon as he heard about the attack. We're taking you to safety. We're just waiting for the all clear.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How’d he know? It just happened!

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: You didn’t think Dumbledore’d let you wander around on your own, did you? Lupin indicates Tonks.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Harry, I don’t believe you've met Nymphadora Tonks. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Tonks, would you go get Harry's broom from the house? She nods and departs.  Harry looks at Lupin.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What's been going on? What's Lord Vol- Three of the advanced guard jump.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: We're not talking about it here, it's too risky. Moody's eye stuck backwards in his head.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Blast it. He pulls his eye from it's socket with a horrible sucking sound.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: Mad-eye, dear, you do realize that's disgusting?

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: I want 365 degree visibility on the return trip.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How are we getting there?

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Brooms. Red sparks fly into the air in the distance. Tonks returns with the broom, handing it to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: KINGSLEY
dialogues.text: There's the first signal.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Right, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: On your broom, Harry. Moody is moving around them.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Form up! Form up around Harry. Make it snappy!  The advanced guard surrounds Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: We'll be flying in close-quarters formation. Tonks will be right in front of you, keep close to her at all times. (pause) Don't stop, and whatever you do, don't break formation. If any of us are killed, the rest of you, keep flying. (pause) If that were to happen, the survivors, fly to the east. The rear guard is standing by. They will find you.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: Stop being so cheerful, Mad-eye.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: We must be ready. This would be the perfect moment for Voldemort to strike Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Uh, is that very likely?

dialogues.speaker: KINGSLEY
dialogues.text: No one's going to die. Blue sparks blast into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: There's the second signal!

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Mount your brooms, everyone. Here we go! Seconds later, there is an explosion of green sparks in t sky.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: The third signal, everyone. Let's go! They kick off from the ground, which is swiftly left behi

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Stay in formation!  10. They are not as high as the clouds yet.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: We need more height! It is only seconds later, that another warning is shouted their way. A dementor soars towards them, tattered robes snapping in wind.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Contacts to the south!

dialogues.speaker: KINGSLEY
dialogues.text: Mad-eye! You, Tonks, and Lupin take Harry! We'll slow them down! The rest of the advanced guard peels away from the group. Harry checks the sky around them. It appears to be clear.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: There's the other one, Alastor! The other Dementor emerges very close by from a cloud.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Expecto--!

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Harry, leave it to us! And Lupin peels away, rocketing towards the Dementor.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No! Lupin goes straight at the Dementor, which smoothly flips upwards, bypassing Lupin, but Lupin twists his broom arou his wand drawn, and points it at the Dementor's retreatin back.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: 'Expecto Patronum!' Lupin's PATRONOUS explodes from his wand tip, pulsing out through the clouds at the Dementor. The light blasts into and the Dementor, shrieking eerily, retreats back towards rest of the advanced guard. Lupin rockets past Harry, Tonks, and Moody.  11.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Get Harry to the safe house!

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Come on, Potter! Keep moving!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But I can help!

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Potter, getting yourself killed won't do a thing. Now move! Glaring at Moody, Harry wheels his broom around and the t of them set off again, leaving the battle behind.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: We're not far, now! Soon after, Lupin and the rest of the advanced guard retu intact and without injury.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Did you get rid of them?

dialogues.speaker: KINGSLEY
dialogues.text: They're gone, Alastor.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: We're there!

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Prepare for descent! Form up around Harry! They cut through the clouds, gliding lower as they went. Tonks touches down right before Harry did, the rest glidi down while maintaining their formation around Harry. All business, they draw their wands.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Stay here, Harry. Several of the advanced guard move to the perimeter, to secure it.

dialogues.speaker: KINGSLEY
dialogues.text: Clear!

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Right, Harry, this way.  12. Harry follows him, Tonks and Lupin trailing after, wands the ready, eyes flicking to the buildings surrounding the

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Here, read this. He hands Harry a piece of paper. It has written on it: "T Headquarters of the Order of the Phoenix may be found at Number Twelve, Grimmauld Place, London." Harry looks at the gap between the houses, and suddenly a door appears, followed by the rest of a large, gray, rath imposing house. Moody takes the paper from Harry and set it afire with hi wand.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: Come on, inside. Hurry. LUPIN and TONKS step up, close to Harry, one on either si The guards at the perimeter close in a semi-circle around door. LUPIN taps the door with his wand, and it cracks open.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Get in, quick, Harry. Don't touch anything.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GRIMMAULD PLACE
dialogues.text: Harry enters the musty entry hall. To one side is a stair leading up to the next level. At the base of the stair is dirty, graying sheet hanging on the wall, as if it were covering something. Behind him, the other members of the advanced guard are entering. To make room, Harry steps to one side, and runs into an umbrella stand, which clangs loudly as it hits th ground. To steady himself, he reaches out and pulls the sheet fro the wall. Behind it is a portrait of an unpleasant, old, thin, woman.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BLACK
dialogues.text: Filth! Scum! Half-breeds, mutants, freaks, begone from this place! How dare you befoul the house of my fathers?!  13. SIRIUS BLACK comes running into the entry hall. He skids halt next to Harry, looking up at MRS BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Shut up, you miserable old hag! Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: MRS BLACK
dialogues.text: Blood traitor, abomination, shame of my flesh!

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, do shut up! He throws the sheet over the picture, and the yells die a Panting, SIRIUS looks at Harry and grins. He wraps Harry huge bear hug. Harry laughs. Pulling away, Sirius smiles at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Was that your--?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Mother, yes. Dear old mum.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But...why here?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: This house has been my family's for centuries. It's mine now. (pause) I'm the last of the Blacks. I offered it up as headquarters for, well, and Dumbledore accepted. It's about the most useful thing I've been able to do for a long while. MRS WEASLEY enters the hall.

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Hello, Harry dear.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Mrs. Weasley!

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Sirius, the meeting is about to start!  14.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry, dear, go on upstairs- quietly, if you please. They're all up there. Harry looks up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry! Harry looks up the stairs and sees RON and HERMIONE stand on the landing. He mounts the stairs to both of them, grinning. Hermione throws herself on Harry in a large hug, laughing

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Let him breathe, Hermione!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Oh, Harry! We've missed you! Are you furious with us, I bet you are!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Hermione lets Harry go and takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Good to see you, mate.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Come on, inside. They enter an adjacent bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit down on separate beds.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Sorry we haven't written, Harry, but Dumbledore made us promise not to.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We wanted to, mate, we really did, but he thought they would get intercepted.  15. There is an awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: He thought you would be safest there.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, real safe. Attacked by Dementors, that's safe, that is.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He was so angry when he heard. It was...scary...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So, why's he keeping me in the dark? Hermione and Ron look awkward.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Didn't you bother asking?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We've only seen him twice, and not for very long. He's really busy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So I get to spend the summer with the Dursleys while you two are here.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It's not that fun, mate. Mum won't let us anywhere near the meetings.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You've still been here! Hermione and Ron are looking aghast at Harry. Harry looks away. There is a silence.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What's been going on?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: We've already told you, we're not privyed to the meetings. But we do know a few things.  16.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Some of the Order are following known Death Eaters, like Lucious Malfoy. (pause) And they're guarding something.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s this Order everyone's talking about?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: The Order of the Phoenix. Dumbledore started it last time to fight You-Know-Who. He only reorganized it after last term. Moments later, MRS. WEASLEY opens the door to their room.

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: You can come down now, the meeting's over. They stand up to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ginny, Hermione, Ron, and Mrs. Weasley enter the KITCHEN, which has been set up with long tables and chair At the far end of the long table, MR. WEASLEY and CHARLIE WEASLEY are talking quietly over a parchment.

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Arthur- MR. WEASLEY looks up, sees them, and nods to Charlie, who rolls up the parchment hastily, and rises from his seat, moving across the room. Harry sits down at the table, across from Sirius.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Well, the Ministry is furious with you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: You did magic in front of your muggle cousin. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRIUS (cont'd) You'll have to go to an disciplinary meeting tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay. Harry stands up.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm not really hungry. I think I'll go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: You surprise me, Harry. I figured the first thing you'd do is start asking about Voldemort. Harry pauses, then turns around. The room has gone very still. Mrs. Weasley is glaring at Sirius.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I wanted to, but I didn't think you'd tell me anything.

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: And that was quite right, Harry! You're much to young--

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: He has a right to know, Molly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: It's not your decision!

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: I know what Dumbledore said, but he needs to know something.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (grinning) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: He's not a child, Molly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: He's not an adult either! (pause) He's not James. 17.  18.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: (stiffly) I'm fully aware of who he is, Molly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: I only have Harry's best interests at heart.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: He's not your son.

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Who else does he have, then? Sirius stands, glaring at Mrs. Weasley.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: He's got me. He's like a son to me. Harry stares at Sirius in surprise. Mrs. Weasley turns an storms out. Sirius sits, heavily.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: What do you want to know, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where's Voldemort? What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: He's hiding for the moment, because the Ministry is ignoring his return and he doesn't want that to change.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: (smiling) You really messed things up for him last year, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: The last person You-Know-Who wanted to alert was Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And what's his plan?  19.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: He's building up his army again, just like before.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And you're stopping him from gaining followers?

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: We're doing our best, but it's proving to be...difficult.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: You see, when the Ministry of Magic insists that Voldemort isn't back.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But...why?

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Fudge likes being Minister of Magic. If it turns out that Voldemort came back under his watch, he'll be sacked.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But you're telling people, right? Sirius laughed.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Well, they think I'm a mass- murderer, Lupin is a werewolf, Tonks and Arthur would lose their jobs at the Ministry...

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: But Dumbledore is doing all he can.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: If he keeps it up, he might end up in Azkaban. And that would give You- Know-Who a clear field to-- MR WEASLEY stops short and looks as if he'd nearly said t much.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?  20.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: You-Know-Who wants something. Something he didn't have last time. A weapon.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What kind of weapon? Lupin and Sirius exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Harry, we can't say anything more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sleeps. He dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry moves slowly down a dark hallway. It has many, bolt doors down its long sides. Soon he is running. Then, suddenly, he is being pulled al the doors rushing past faster and faster. Harry can see t end of the hallway, it is a blinding light, still only a speck. It grows larger as he rockets towards it, then he flies r into it and the light explodes all around him, engulfing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry wakes with a CRY, sitting straight up in bed. He's covered in sweat, looking disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. WEASLEY, MR WEASLEY, LUPIN, RON, HERMIONE, and GINNY standing in the hall, waiting, as Sirius and Harry descen the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MRS WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Morning, dear! Did you have a good sleep?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, my scar kept hurting. MR. WEASLEY and LUPIN exchange nervous glances.  21.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: (bracingly) Probably just nerves...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah...nerves...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Good luck, Harry! She hugs Harry. After the hug, Harry stands back, but is suddenly hugged Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: They'll have to let you off, Harry... You were defending yourself! I checked the laws.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What does he get a hug for?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (cooly) When you have to go to a disciplinary hearing at the Ministry of Magic, I'll hug you too.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Oh, sure, that's why.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Ronald Weasley, are you jealous?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (glancing at the smirking Ginny and Mrs. Weasley) Me? Jealous? Of course not, it just doesn't seem fair that you hug one friend more than the other, is all...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Would you like a hug?  22.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (miffed) No, I'd hate to force you... Harry grins and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Well, come on, Harry. Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Bye. He waves, and he and MR WEASLEY depart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is not very crowded, as the sun rises in the e Harry and Mr. Weasley hurry along the sidewalk and come t PHONEBOOTH. Mr. Weasley looks around cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Good, good, not very many Muggles. He opens the PHONEBOOTH and slips inside. He beckons to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Well, come on Harry, in we go. Harry slips inside the booth, and Mr. Weasley, with some difficulty, closes the door behind them. Mr. Weasley picks up the phone and listens in the wrong e for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: I do love using the Fellytone! Now, let's see, what's the number again... He punches in SIX, TWO, FOUR, FOUR, TWO. There is a tap on the glass of the box. Mr. Weasley glanc out of the window to see a MUGGLE MAN standing outside. T MAN taps his watch impatiently. Mr. Weasley holds up a finger, as to say, "just a second. The MAN sighs and turns around, tapping his foot.  23.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Ministry of Magic. Please state your business.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry Potter, disciplinary hearing.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Pleas stand by. There is a pause, and then the whole phone booth begins t sink down into the ground. The MAN, his back to the booth, is completely oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The booth sinks lower into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Usually I Apparate, but you're too young, so I thought we'd take the scenic route. The booth SHUDDERS to a halt, and the door slides open, revealing a large lobby, filled with busy-looking wizards witches going to and fro. Harry and Mr. Weasley exit the phone booth and enter the lobby. The door to the PHONE BOOTH closes, and it slides up agai out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THe MUGGLE MAN stands tapping his foot. The booth reemerges topside and stops, looking very innoc The man turns around, blinks, and glances around for the people that had been inside it before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Weasley walks through the crowd of wizards.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Keep close, Harry! A stooped, timid-looking, white-haired wizard pushes his through the crowd towards Mr. Weasley.  24.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Ah, Perkins, good morn-

dialogues.speaker: PERKINS
dialogues.text: Arthur, they've changed the time of Potter's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Blast! Dumbledore thought they might try that.

dialogues.speaker: PERKINS
dialogues.text: It started at eight!

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Good lord, that was five minutes ago! Come on, Harry! They break into a run. They jog down hallway after hallwa then Mr Weasley leads Harry onto a large lift. There are several other witches and wizards on it. It descends shudderingly for a few moments, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Department of Mysteries.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Department of Mysteries?

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Yep, I've got no idea what they get up to in here, it's top secret. The lift doors open. Harry and Mr. Weasley exit, running corridors. Harry skids to a stop and looks down a dark hallway. Mr. Weasley stops as well, and glances back at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Come on, Harry!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I've been there before... Mr. WEASLEY looks nervous, then grabs Harry's robes and d him along.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Now, Harry, I find that highly unlikely...  25. A few moments later, they arrive.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: There you are, Harry, in you go...good luck... Harry enters the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One side of the courtroom is an elevated zigarat-shaped series of seats carved from black stone. The whole room is dark, save a light shining through from ceiling down on the center of the room, where a single wo chair sits, covered in chains.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Er...sorry.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: No matter, the accused will take his seat. Harry does so, glancing nervously at the chains on it.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Very well, we are ready to begin.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Witness for the Defence, Albus Percival Wulfric Brian Dumbledore. Harry turns in his seat. Dumbledore stands by the door of the COURTROOM, looking u the Minister.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Ah...you...er...got our message that the time had changed, did you?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Must have missed it. (pause) However, due to a fortunate mistake, I arrived at the Ministry three hours early.  26. DUMBLEDORE conjures up a SQUASHY, CHINTZ armchair next to Harry's and sits down with a mild squeak. He steeples his fingers and looks up at the Minister with expression of polite interest.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Well. The...ah...charges. He consults his notes.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: The charges against the accused shall now be read into the record: That the accused did with deliberation and fore-knowledge of the illegality of his actions, produce a patronus charm in full sight of a Muggle. (pause) (To Harry) You are Harry James Potter?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: And you conjured a patronus on the night of the eleventh of August?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, but-

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Within full sight of a Muggle?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, but-

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BONES
dialogues.text: You produced a Patronus? A fully- formed Patronus, with a clearly- defined shape?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BONES
dialogues.text: That is most remarkable, Mr. Potter.  27.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter how impressive it was!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But I did it because of the Dementors!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BONES
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My cousin and I were attacked by Dementors. That's why I had to use the Patronus, to drive them away.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Ah, yes, yes, another cock-and-bull story.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It's the truth!

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Of course it is.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BONES
dialogues.text: Dementors in Little Whinging?

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Oh, come now, Susan. He's clearly lying.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Actually, we have a witness to the presence of the Dementors in question.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: We haven't got time to-

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I may be wrong, but I do believe that it says somewhere in the Wizagammot Charter of Rights that the Accused has the right to present witnesses to prove his or her case? In fact, I do believe I wrote that particular bit myself.  28.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Very well. Weasley, fetch the witness. Percy goes to the door and lets MRS. FIGG in. She stands in front of Harry and Dumbledore nervously.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Full name?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. FIGG
dialogues.text: Arabella Doreen Figg, resident of Little Whinging.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: So...what is your story?

dialogues.speaker: FIGG
dialogues.text: I was sitting on my porch when I saw the two Dementors gliding towards the two boys.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BONES
dialogues.text: What did the Dementors look like?

dialogues.speaker: FIGG
dialogues.text: Well, they were big and wore great, tattered cloaks. There is some murmuring among the Wizengamot at that.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BONES
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: FIGG
dialogues.text: I-I felt them. It was horrible...like I would never be happy again.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Very well, you may go. MRS FIGG hurrys from the COURTROOM.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Not very convincing.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BONES
dialogues.text: Oh, I disagree. She described their effects very completely.  29.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: So two Dementors just happen to be in Little Whinging? I think not...

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Only if the Dementors are still taking their orders from only the Ministry these days. I believe you know my views on this, Cornelius.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Yes, and they're nothing but bilge, Dumbledore. UMBRIDGE shifts into the light. She is a short, ugly, toa like woman.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Dumbledore, but did you just accused the Ministry of Magic of ordering an attack on this boy?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: If the Dementors are taking their orders from the Ministry exclusively, then it must certainly follow logically that someone in the Ministry ordered the attack. (pause) And in that case, I'm sure the Ministry will make a full inquiry.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Dementors are irrelevant!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: On the contrary, Cornelius. If they were there, then Harry was acting in self-defense, which is perfectly allowable under Clause Seven of the Decree of Reasonable Restriction of Underaged Wizardry. (pause) We are all in agreement on this?

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Well, yes, if he's telling the truth!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: You have heard it from eye- witnesses, Cornelius.  30.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Very well, all for clearing the accused of charges? He glances around the room, noting all the hands in the a

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: All opposed? Only a few hands.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: (angrily) Fine! Cleared of all charges!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Excellent. Dumbledore gets out of his chair, vanishes it with the wa of a wand, and sweeps from the COURTROOM. Harry gets out of the wooden chair, glances upward at Umbridge. Their eyes meet for a split second. She glowers at him. Harry exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry exits the COURTROOM to find Mr. Weasley standing outside, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry, you've been let off! That's wonderful! The door opens again and the whole of the Wizengamot exit

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: You were tried by the full court?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think so, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: (concerned) Well, no matter. Let's go home. Just then, Percy exits and brushes by Mr. Weasley without even looking at him.  31.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Er...is Percy mad at you?

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Ah...yes...I'm afraid we had a bit of a row. He, well, he sided with Fudge and the rest of us sided with Dumbledore, so Percy left. They begin walking away from the courtroom, when they com upon Fudge talking quietly with LUCIUS MALFOY, standing a the mouth of the corridor Harry had recognized earlier.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: Well, well, if it isn't Patronus Potter. (pause) The Minister here was just telling me how very lucky an escape you just had. Quite astonishing...snakelike, in fact.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: Come now, Potter, I really don't think that private matters between the Minister and myself are any concern of yours. Lucius moves closer to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: (lowly) All you need to concern yourself about are...your dreams, Potter. And Lucius smiles malevolently at Harry. Lucius steps back and turns to the Minister.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: Shall we continue this in your office, Fudge?

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Certainly. Harry watches them go.  32.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: If he wanted to talk to the Minister, why down here?

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Dunno, Harry. Some things are just beyond comprehension. As he speaks, Mr Weasley glances down the long, dark hall with a worried look.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GRIMMAULD PLACE
dialogues.text: Harry stands in the kitchen of GRIMMAULD PLACE, surrounde Ron, Ginny, Fred, George, Hermione, Sirius, Lupin, Mr and Weasley, and Tonks.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (shouting) I knew it! In the background, Ginny, Fred, and George are dancing a strange JIG.

dialogues.speaker: FRED, GEORGE, AND GINNY
dialogues.text: (singing) He got off, he got off, he got off! Hermione hugs Harry again. Ron glowers at her.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Settle down, you three! The chanting and dancing dies away. Mrs Weasley exits the Kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Sirius, we saw Fudge talking with Lucius Malfoy on Level Nine again. Tell Dumbledore, next time he comes in, would you?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Well, I'd better be off. I've got a bewitched vomiting toilet to deal with.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: George, remember that concept. Vomiting Toilet.  33.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Right you are, Fred.

dialogues.speaker: MR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Also, I'm covering for Tonks on guard duty later tonight, so I won't be back until late. Harry's scar explodes in pain. He yelps, and claps his ha to his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Harry! Harry gasps with pain and falls to his knees. Then, as suddenly as it had come, the pain vanishes. Shaken, Harry gasps as Sirius helps him over to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: You all right, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah...just...my scar...the pain is getting stronger. Sirius gives a worried glance to Lupin, who looks grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits on his bunk, thinking. Sirius enters the room, Harry barely reacts, still gazing into space.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Harry, I've got something that might interest you. Harry looks up. Sirius sits on the edge of the bed and brandishes an old, tattered photo. Harry takes it.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: This was the original Order of the Phoenix. Found it while we were cleaning. Harry looks down at all the smiling faces.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: There's Mad-eye and Dumbledore, right next to Dedalus Diggle; Marlene McKinnon, she was killed two weeks after this was taken...; (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRIUS (cont'd) then there's Frank and Alice Longbottom, tortured into insanity by Death Eaters; Lupin, of course.. (pause) Ah, Edgar Bones, they only ever found bits of him; Caradoc Dearborn, he vanished six months later...; Hagrid, of course; Gideon and Fabian Prewett, it took five Death Eaters to finish those two off; me, of course...; and there they are! Harry watches his parents beam up at him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My parents. He watches the picture for a long second.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I miss them, Sirius...

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: I know, Harry, I know. I miss them too. He puts his arm around Harry.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: It's not fair that I got to spend so much time with them and you didn't... Harry closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why'd they have to die, Sirius, why?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: I don't know, Harry. I wish I did, but I don't... There is a long moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: I know I'm not your father, Harry, but I'll always be there for you, if I can help it...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks.  35. The door cracks open, and an ugly, menacing HOUSE ELF ent looking around suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: (muttering) That mudblood with the scar, he cries, why does he cry so...?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Kreacher, get out of here! Now!

dialogues.speaker: KREACHER
dialogues.text: Oh, how the old Mistress would weep to see the traitor in her house... The elf exits.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who..who was that?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Kreacher. He's been alone with the house for years, he's gone a bit funny. (pause) You'd better get some rest. Sirius gets up and exits. Ron and Hermione burst into the room seconds later.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron and I, we've been named House Prefects! She hands Harry a letter. There are a few seconds of parchment ripping.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What about you, Harry? But there is no PREFECT BADGE in Harry's letter. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Are you sure? I would have thought you would get one!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm sure. Nothing.  36. There is an awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So...congratulations Ron, Hermione...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Well...thanks Harry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Come on, lets go back downstairs!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, do go enjoy yourselves. Harry lays down on his bed away from them. He hears them leave. He is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOGWARTS EXPRESS rushes past the moors of SCOTLAND on way to Hogwarts. Soon it is night again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ginny, Ron, and Hermione exit the HOGWARTS EXPRESS move quickly though the crowd of students to the carriage that would take them to the castle. As they prepare to climb into one of the carriages, Harry stops and stares towards the front of the carriage. There is a large reptilian, horse-like creature harnessed the front whereas always before there was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (looking) What?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (pointing) That...that...thing! RON stares for a long moment, then looks at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry, there's nothing there, mate...  37.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes it is, it's right there! He points. Ron shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA LOVEGOOD
dialogues.text: I see them too, Harry. Harry turns to her. LUNA LOVEGOOD is a spacy-looking girl yet pretty in her own right.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Er...you are?

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: Luna. Luna Lovegood.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, thanks Luna. They clamber into the carriage, Luna following. It starts moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks out into the darkness of the HOGWARTS GROUNDS spies Hagrid's hut in the dark. All the lights are off within.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hagrid's cabin looks deserted.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I hope he's all right...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What if he were still on his... He glances at Luna, who has vanished behind the latest edition of the QUIBBLER MAGAZINE.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: -.-what if he's still on his mission from Dumbledore?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, could be. Moments later the carriages halt, and the students pile o  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hogwarts Headmaster, PROFESSOR DUMBLEDORE, a wizzened old with a great white beard to his belt and long white hair, stands to address the school.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I beg a few moments of your attention, as I have a few start of term announcements. Right off, our caretaker, the good Mr. Filch, has reminded me for what he says is the four-hundred and sixty-second time that he had an annually updated list of various banned items, usually introduced by our humour experts Fred and George Weasley... Fred and George stand and take a bow to cheering, laughte and yells.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-which are posted in an extensive list on the door to Mr. Filch's door. Harry grins at Fred and George.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Also, we have two staffing changes this year. Professor Grubby-Plank will be taking the post of Care of Magical Creatures post as Professor Hagrid is on...extended leave. Harry, Ron, and Hermione exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Additionally, we have Professor Umbridge, who has kindly agreed to fill the post of Defense Against the Dark Arts- At this, UMBRIDGE stands and clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Hem, hem, Headmaster, if I could address the school? Dumbledore looks taken aback. McGonogall glares at UMBRID Dumbledore sits down and invites Umbridge forward.  39.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Headmaster. Now, how are we all doing tonight? I thought I would just say a few words. I am here at the Ministry of Magic's bequest, under Educational Decree twenty-two, which states that if the Headmaster of Hogwarts is unable to fill any teaching post the Ministry shall select one for the position. Dumbledore inclines his head. There is murmuring from the students.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: The Ministry has always considered the magical education of our children to be of vital importance, and the passing down of this ancient and noble art must be given to the next generation, lest it be lost forever... (pause) Without progress, stagnation. But progress for progress's sake is to be discouraged, for our art requires no tinkering. (pause) A balance must be attained, the new and the old, permanence and change, tradition and innovation, order and chaos. (pause) There are large changes coming soon, changes walking the fine line between order and chaos. Know only that these changes are for the best, and to prevent the destruction of our civilization from its own decay. Thank you. Umbridge smiles at them all, but to Harry, the smile seem little forced, a little fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry enters the boys DORMITORY. Within the room are a nu of POSTER BEDS. Harry goes to his and sits down. Also in the room are DEAN THOMAS, NEVILLE LONGBOTTOM, and SEAMUS FINNIGAN.  40.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: So why didn't your mum want you to come back to Hogwarts, Seamus?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: Me mam didn't want me to come back to Hogwarts...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: Well...because of you...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: She...well, she figure's you're, well...you're lying about You-Know- Who and Dumbledore's a right nutter...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where'd she get that from? Seamus picks up an edition of the DAILY PROPHET and tosse to Harry. Harry catches it and looks at the front page. It READS: "Harry Potter: Boy Hero Uses Lies to Seek Attention" with the subheading of "Hogwarts Headmaster Bu His Story."

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So...she believes this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: Well...yeah...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But...but you believe me, don't you? Seamus looks away. Harry turns and storms out of the DORM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits on the top of the ASTRONOMY TOWER, looking out over the LAKE and the FORBIDDEN FOREST in the distance, Hagrid's hut dark and forboding at the edge of the FOREST  4l. Hedwig sits on the PARAPET next to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No one believes me, Hedwig. No one... He turns and leans against the stone PARAPET, then slides down to the ground, his back against the cold stone.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm alone... Hedwig takes off into the night, flying over the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry runs down the halls of Hogwarts. He skids around a corner, and pushes through the door to the DEFENSE AGAINS THE DARK ARTS CLASSROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole class looks around at Harry as he comes stagger in.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Professor... PROFESSOR UMBRIDGE smiles, TOAD-LIKE, at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Hmm, let's see, five points from Gryffindor for coming in late. Harry frowns, but sits down next to Ron and Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Now, as I was saying before Mr. Potter interrupted with his antics, your Defense Against the Dark Arts education has been rather fragmented and disjointed in your past classes, hasn't it? (pause) Know now that this is about to be rectified. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UMBRIDGE (cont'd) I will be following a pre-approved Ministry-prepared, theory-centered Defense lesson plan. She waves her wand at the blackboard and words are writte down on it.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Copy this down. Everyone opens their books and begins copying, except Hermione, who sits with her book unopened, her hand in th air. Umbridge ignores her. However, within the next few seconds, nearly the whole cl is watching Hermione. Umbridge sighs.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I wanted to know something about your course aims.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Well, they should be perfectly self- evident.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Well, I don't think they are. They say nothing about actually doing spells.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: (laughing) I can imagine no circumstance in my class where you would need to use spells, my dear!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: But surely the whole point of Defense against the dark arts is practical application?

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Miss Granger, this class has been approved by Ministry experts. Are you a Ministry Expert?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No, but-  43.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Then you have no business challenging those who are. We will be learning about spells in a safe, risk-free environment-

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: But we've got O.W.L.s coming up! You expect us to do the spells with no practice?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What good's theory in the real world?

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: This is school, not the real world, Mr. Potter. There is nothing out there waiting to get you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What about Lord Voldemort? The whole class flinched at the sound of the name.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Ten points from Gryffindor, Mr. Potter. Let me set the record straight. She stands behind her desk, leaning on her knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Some of you have been told that a certain dead wizard has returned. This is a lie. Harry stands up, knocking his books to the ground, a look livid rage on his face.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It-is-NOT-a-LIE!

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Mr. Potter, you have just landed yourself in detention! Harry moves around his desk stiffly, trembling with rage, eyes dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So, according to you, Cedric Diggory dropped dead? Or are you calling me a murderer?

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: The boy's death was a tragic accident. Harry has reached the desk. He slams his fists against th wood, thrusting his face right up to Umbridge's, glaring her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It was MURDER! I saw it happen! The class is deathly still. PARVATI PATIL is covering her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Mr Potter, you have earned yourself a week's worth of detentions!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, talk to somebody who cares. Voldemort killed Cedric, and you know it. Umbridge snatches a QUILL up and scribbles a note, and ha it to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: That goes to Professor McGonogall, dear. Harry rips it from her hand and storms out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry storms down the halls, turns a corner, and practica kicks open the door to McGonogall's office. INT. McGONOGALL'S OFFICE - DAY Harry stomps in and hands the note to McGonogall. She takes it and glances at it.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONOGALL
dialogues.text: Is this true? Did you shout at Professor Umbridge?  45.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. But she called me a liar!

dialogues.speaker: MCGONOGALL
dialogues.text: My dear boy, do use your common sense! Umbridge is reporting directly to Fudge. She is here to...interfere...with Dumbledore. And things could get much worse, trust me. (pause) Use caution, always, Potter. Do not mess with Dolorus Umbridge, she is dangerous. The Order's hands are tied at Hogwarts, Harry. If you get too deep into trouble, we may not be able to get you out. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONOGALL
dialogues.text: Good. Off you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Hermione, and Ron sit in a corner of the large com room, trying to ignore the talking and chattering going o all around them.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: How can Dumbledore let that horrible woman teach? And when we're taking our OWL tests too!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You reckon she's here to spy on us?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Well, not us specifically, but definitely Dumbledore and the Order. At that moment, ANGELINA JOHNSON comes up to them.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELINA
dialogues.text: (angrily) Well, way to go, Potter. Your detention is at the same time as Quidditch practice!  46.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh! Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: ANGELINA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you're going to have to get out of it somehow. We're holding tryouts for Keeper now Wood's gone, and I wanted to have the whole team there.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'll never get out of it, Angelina.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELINA
dialogues.text: Well, just...don't do it again! And she storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are heading back inside to the GRYFFINDOR COMMON ROOM. The sun is setting in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Well, Harry, shall we start on Snape's report?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Later, I've got detention.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Good luck, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to her office creaks open, and Harry enters.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Ah, Potter. Sit down. Harry sits in a chair right in front of her desk.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: You're going to be doing lines, tonight, Mr. Potter, and you'll be using this quill. The QUILL was BLOOD-RED and sinister looking.  47. Harry takes it.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: You will write "I will not tell lies" until I tell you to stop. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: There's no ink.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Oh...you won't need ink. Harry begins to write, then gasps in pain. He looks at hi hand, and finds that "I will not tell lies" has carved it in the skin of his hand, and the quill had written the wo on the parchment in bright red BLOOD. Then the words healed over again, on his hand. Harry glances at Umbridge, who is smiling evilly.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Problem, Potter? Harry shakes his head and returns to his lines. He gasps after writing it again, the words on his hand had gotten deeper. Gritting his teeth, he forces himself on.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE
dialogues.text: Harry's shaking, weak hand scratches the final line of th evening, the words on the back of his hand not even heali any longer, but bleeding profusely.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: That's enough for this evening. Same time, tomorrow, and we'll see if we can get the message to sink in a bit deeper. Harry staggers to his feet, weak and pale, and staggers f the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry exits Umbridge's office and staggers down the hall around a corner, then breaks into a terrified run.  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry moves down the dark hallway again, slowly, meaningfully. Locked doors are all around him, lining the walls as far down as he could see. He breaks into a jog, and then a run, then a sprint. The doors rush past him. Suddenly an invisible force grabs him and pulls him along faster and faster, the doors a blur. Then he saw the end, blinding light, which he blasts into with a SMACK, and as light fades, he catches a glimpse of a further room, beyo the light, for only an instant. Then it too is gone, and Harry awakes with a yelp, hands pressed against his scar, which is BURNING horribly. He rubs it, until the pain goes away.

dialogues.speaker: INT, GRYFFINDOR COMMON ROOM
dialogues.text: Hermione steps into the common room, looking puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Hey, Harry. He looks up from his parchment.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Have you seen Ron? I can’t find him anywhere. Harry shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, I haven’t.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He’s been acting fishy all week. He’s up to something. Harry packs up his parchments.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (absentmindedly) Uh huh. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Another night, another detention.  49. INT. UMBRIDGE’S OFFICE - NIGHT Harry scratches away with the horrible quill, gritting hi teeth, determined not to make a sound. Sweat beads on his face, and blood is flowing freely from the cuts on his ha

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: That’s enough for tonight, Potter. Let’s see that hand. She reaches out and touches his hand. Instantly, pain explodes in his scar and Harry leaps back as if electrocu stumbling due to blood loss. He clutches at his scar in agony. Harry stares at her in horror. She grins unpleasantly. He staggers backward and out the door to her office witho another word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry attempts to run down the hallway, swaying on his fe as a drunk. Blood pours down his hand, dribbling onto the floor. He staggers toward the PORTRAIT HOLE back to the Gryffind commons. It stands open, and Harry passes through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Quidditch team stands around, talking. Ron spies Harr

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry! I tried out for Quidditch Keeper at the tryouts! I’m on the team! Everything stops as they take in the sight of Harry, pale gaunt, barely standing, with one hand clutching his scar the other hanging limply at his side, covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry--bloody hell! Harry’s knees give out, and he falls to the floor. Fred, George, Ron, and Hermione lift him up.  50.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: He’s got to be taken to the hospital wing.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (weakly) No. Can’t give...Umbridge the satisfaction...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Umbridge did this?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You said she was making you do lines! They settle Harry back down.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: She is. But the quill has some sort of spell on it. It uses blood for ink.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: That old hag! She’s sick! Hermione looks horrified.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Oh, Harry. You’ve got to go to Dumbledore. You can’t keep this up.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, I’m telling anyone.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, I really think you should tell--

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No! Harry climbs slowly to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t need his help. I don’t need anyone’s help. He pushes past them and limps up into the boys’ dorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits at the Gryffindor table, bent over a parchment his quill scratching away. He looks up, finished. Ron and Hermione join him. Hermione is staring up at the teacher’s table. Hagrid’s c is still empty.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Hagrid’s still not back yet. I hope he’s all right.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’ve asked Sirius about it. He indicates the parchment. Hermione pulls it towards her She looks startled.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, you can’t write to him! Owls are being intercepted, it isn’t safe.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, Hermione, I wrote it in code. Anyway, I figured I need to tell someone about Umbridge. My scar hurt again last night in detention.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Always knew she was a bit fishy.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You think she’s working for You- Know-Who?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, it’s a possibility, isn’t it? Hermione looks dubious.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I suppose so. He could have her under the Imperious Curse, though it’s unlikely. Dumbledore’d know. Harry leans in even closer.  52.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but Dumbledore didn’t have a choice, did he? She’d been sent here by the Ministry. Hermione unfurls a copy of the Daily Prophet.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Anything about Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No, nothing. (pause) Wait! Look at this! She slaps the paper down on the table. Harry and Ron lean closer.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (reading) “Trespass at Ministry. Sturgis Podmore has appeared before the Wizengamot with charges of trespass and attempted robbery at the Ministry of Magic on the 31st of August. He was arrested when found trying to break into a top-security door at one in the morning. Podmore was convicted and sentenced to six months in Azkaban.”

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sturgis Podmore?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Wait, he’s one of the Order! Hermione glares at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Do you s’pose it was a frameup? They stop talking. Dean Thomas walks by.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Come on, we'll be late for Charms if we don’t hurry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Right.  53. Harry takes back the parchment and stands.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You go on without me. I want to send this. They part ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry steps into the OWLRY, the floor covered in straw an hundreds of owls hooting softly on many roosts.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hedwig! Hedwig flutters down to him. He gives the parchment to th owl. She flies out of the open window and soars away, out sight over the Forbidden Forest. Harry watches the forest. A huge animal which appeared to a winged reptilian horse. Harry frowns. Behind him, the door creaks open. He turns to see CHO CHA entering.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Oh...hi. Didn’t think anyone else would be up here. She moves to a brown school owl. There is an awkward sile

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Have you found a new Keeper for Quiddich?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, my friend Ron Weasley. She ties the package to the owl.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: He any good?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, he made the team. I missed the tryouts. She lets go of the owl and it flies out the window.  54.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Yeah, Umbridge. You were really brave, standing up to her. Harry straightens, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah...well, it was the truth. The owlry door bursts open again. ARGUS FILCH charges in.

dialogues.speaker: FILCH
dialogues.text: Right, Potter. I’1l have what you're sending.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FILCH
dialogues.text: I have had a tip-off that you are ordering a large quantity of Dungbombs! Now hand it over.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You’re too late, it’s gone. Filch looks furious.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Yeah, I saw him send it. Filch regards her for a moment, then turns back to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: FILCH
dialogues.text: I get a single whiff of a Dungbomb in this castle, Potter...and you’re mine. He turns and departs. There is a silence for a moment as Harry and Cho process had happened.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Um, you weren’t ordering dungbombs, were you?

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: I wonder why he’d think you were. (pause) Well, see you, Harry. She turns and leaves the Owlry. Harry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (v.o.) What a load of rubbish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione, Harry, and Ron are making their way back up to castle. Ron and Harry are in Quiddich robes and caked in Ron is looking upset.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You, ordering dungbombs. I mean, really.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it doesn’t make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Unless whoever tipped Filch off was interested in reading your mail, Harry. I mean, doesn’t it seem a little too coincidental that Filch was tipped off when you happened to be sending a message to Sirius? Harry looks thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that does seem weird. You figure its Umbridge?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Just then Malfoy appears close by.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Hey, Weasley! Nice job out on the field today! You’1l be our best player on the pitch!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Get bent, Malfoy!  56. Draco and the other Slytherins laugh. Ron shakes his head they walk.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No, he’s right. I’m useless out there. Complete rubbish.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s your first practice. Don’t worry about it. Ron looks unusually pale.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m gonna make a fool of myself out there. Harry gasps and rubs at his scar.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Its just...the pain’s getting stronger. Ron and Hermione exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron, and Hermione sit near each other in the commo room. Around them, people talk, laugh, and study. Hermione sighs and shuts her book with a SNAP.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I don’t know how we’re ever going to pass our O.W.L.s in Defense against the dark arts without any practice! That Umbridge woman is SO... She looks at Harry and Ron.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We've got to do something about her. The boys stare at her.  57.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, poison should do the trick.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Don’t be silly, Ron. Not her, I meant her teaching. We’re not going to learn anything in that class.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s true.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Anyway, I thought we should do it ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Defense Against the Dark Arts. We'd teach ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know... There is a TAPPING sound coming from the window. They tur and look.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hermes? He goes to the window and opens it. Hermes deposits a let in Ron’s hands, turns, and vanishes out of the window aga The last Gryiffindor heads for bed, leaving the common ro deserted except for the three of them. Ron opens it and returns to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It’s from Percy!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Read it.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: “Dear Ron, congratulations on becoming a Prefect. For some time I was worried you would take the ‘Fred and George’ route instead of following in my footsteps. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RON (cont'd) You can imagine my relief that this is not the case.” He looks incredulously at Harry and Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Keep reading.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: “Given your attachment to using me as a role model, I will give you a bit of advice from one respecter of authority to another. (pause) It is likely that you have been seeing quite a lot of Harry Potter of late. I must recommend you break ties with that boy as soon as possible. He may be Dumbledore’s favorite, but Dumbledore may not be in charge at Hogwarts much longer. Your loyalties should lie with the Ministry of Magic, not Dumbledore and Potter’s personality cult. (pause) Please do not fear breaking ties with Potter. If trouble arrises, go to Dolores Umbridge, a truly delightful woman. (pause) I hope you will carefully consider my advice to you, Ron. Don’t let the dangerous errors of Dumbledore, Potter, and unfortunately our parents lure you into destroying a perfectly good career. Percy.” Ron looks up, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, if you want to, ah, “break ties” with me, I swear I won’t get violent. Ron tears the letter in half.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: He is the world’s biggest git! He hurls the pieces into the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Watch it!  59. Ron jumps, startled.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sirius?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Right you are. Got you letter and though we should talk in person. He cranes his neck at the burning letter.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Letter from Percy.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, full of the usual rubbish.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Except he did mention that Dumbledore might not be in charge here much longer.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: It doesn’t surprise me. Fudge wants Dumbledore out.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: He’s worried Dumbledore is trying to turn the students against the Ministry.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Well, that would explain why Umbridge isn’t teaching us anything useful in Defense Against the Dark Arts.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Exactly. The Ministry doesn’t want you trained in combat.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What does he think Dumbledore is going to do, raise an army?  60.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: That’s exactly what he’s worried about. Fudge is getting more paranoid about Dumbledore every day. There is a nervous silence in the room.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What do you know about Umbridge?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: She’s a nasty piece of work. Apparently she hates part-humans.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Could she be a Death Eater?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: The Order seriously doubts it. She’s no picnic, but she’s no Death Eater either.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But she’s evil.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: The world isn’t split into the Order and the Death Eaters, Harry. Harry sits back, looking unsatisfied.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: As to your question about Hagrid, well, no one is really sure what happened to him, actually. He was supposed to be back a while ago.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Dumbledore’s not worried about him, though. Hagrid’s tough. He’1l be all right.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: But if he was supposed to be back by now...  61.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Look, asking questions about him will only make it more obvious that he’s not back. Suddenly he glances with concern at the wall of the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Get out of here! His head vanishes. A split second later, a stubby-fingere hand appears in the fire, groping for Sirius’s head. The three of them run for their dormitories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry lays on his bed, fast asleep. He dreams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry strolls along the darkened corridor, passing the ma grey doors. There is only one door that interests him. It lies at the end of the long hall, pure WHITE LIGHT shinin through the gap between door and jam. Harry moves towards it, bathed in shining light. He reach out his hand to the door and grasps the handle. It is loc He shakes the handle and hits the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry’s eyes snap open. He rubs at his scar, wincing in p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione opens her edition of the Daily Prophet and sits in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I cannot believe it! Harry and Ron glance at her. She slaps the paper down on the table.  62.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (reading headline) “Ministry Passes Educational Decree Number Twenty-Three: Dolores Umbridge Appointed Hogwarts High Inquisitor”? He looks at Harry and Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What’s that mean?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It says here that the High Inquisitor has the power to inspect all of the teachers.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You’re kidding!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: That’s not all. The High Inquisitor also has the power to sack teachers as well. Fred and George march by.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: So, seen the news have you?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Personally, I envy you three.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Umbridge is inspecting McGonagall in your period. That old toad won't know what hit her. He looks at Fred wistfully.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh, to be a youth again, to experience the innocent glee of watching Umbridge be destroyed by the greatest Head of Gryffindor this century.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Well, we’ll expect a full report after.  63.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Complete with facial expressions. And they wander off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY stands before her class.

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Greetings my children. I sense even now that many of you have already made the transition into the beyond! Umbridge smiles, toad-like.

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Today we will be continuing our interpretation of prophetic dreams. Please divide into your groups and discuss your recent night time visions using the text as a guide. Ron and Harry open their books, while listening to Trelaw and Umbridge.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: And how long have you been at this post?

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Near to sixteen years I have been the guide to young seers possessed of the Inner sight. Umbridge makes a note.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: I understand you are the descendent of the famous Seer Cassandra Trelawney?

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: And you are the first since Cassandra to have the Second Sight?  64.

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: These things tend to skip...several...generations.
