dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Of course. She makes another note.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Now, if you would kindly make a prediction for me? Trelawney seems to swell with indignation.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: The Inner Eye does not See upon command! Umbridge smiles unpleasantly and makes an extensive note. Trelawney becomes agitated and looks around wildly. She steps up to Harry, who recoils slightly.

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: My dear boy, your dream diary, if you please! Harry nervously hands his diary to her. She takes it with trembling fingers and gazes at it for only a moment. She drops it back to the table and gives a little scream.

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: My dear boy! My poor boy! These dreams are evil portends! Harry looks at the page.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (reading) “Dreamt I was at breakfast eating oatmeal”? Trelawney stares at him for a moment. Umbridge smirks in background, making more notes.

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, oatmeal! Are you telling me you cannot see the signs? The foretelling of suffering and death?

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Perhaps you are not as in the beyond as the others. She sweeps from Harry’s table.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Well, if that’s the best you can do, Professor, I will be going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaves, now a molted brown color, drift off of the trees around Hogwarts. It is now October.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione, Ron, and Harry walk down the crowded streets of Hogsmead, avoiding the swarms of other students.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where are we going, Hermione? She leads them on confidently. They stop before a slightl seedy looking pub.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: There we are.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: “The Hog’s Head,” Hermione? She leads them towards it.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Come on, I’1l explain in a minute. INT. HOG’S HEAD - DAY The three of them step into the pub. It is grimy and ill- Shady witches and wizards sit uneasily in corners. Except for one corner by the front window, which is popul by Dean Thomas, Neville Longbottom, LAVENDER BROWN, Parva and Padma Patil, Cho Chang, Luna Lovegood, KATIE BELL, AL SPINNET, Angelina Johnson, COLIN and DENNIS CRERVEY, ERNI

dialogues.speaker: MACMILLAN, JUSTIN FINCH-FLETCHELY, HANNAH ABBOTT, ANTHONY
dialogues.text: GOLDSTEIN, MICHAEL CORNER, TERRY BOOT, Ginny Weasley, Fre and George Weasley, LEE JORDAN, ZACHARIAS SMITH, SUSAN BO and five others who Harry doesn’t know.  66. Harry looks questioningly at Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione, what’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: These are some people I mentioned my Defense Against the Dark Arts idea with. She sits down. Harry and Ron follow.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You mean about us teaching ourselves?

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Hey, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, Neville.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: (dreamily) It’s good to see that the horned snorkle-stacks haven’t gotten you yet, Harry. Harry looks confused for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Uh...same to you, Luna. Hermione beats on the table to quiet everyone.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Hi, everyone. I thought it would be good if we met and talked over how we wanted to teach ourselves Defense Against the Dark Arts. (pause) Because we need to learn it properly, not the rubbish Umbridge is doing.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Hear, hear!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Obviously, this will help us pass our O.W.L.s, but more importantly, it gives us the ability to protect ourselves from...Lord Voldemort.  67. Several people jump or wince in fear at the name. Hermione takes a shuddering breath, looking exhilarated. looks at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That’s the first time you've said his name. Hermione looks pleased.

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARIAS
dialogues.text: How do we know You-Know-Who’s really back?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Dumbledore believes he is.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN FINCH-FLETCHLY
dialogues.text: You mean Dumbledore believes him. He nods in Harry’s direction.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: That’s true, but I think we’re drifting from the purpose--

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Hermione. He looks at the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I believe Voldemort’s back because I fought him last year. Dumbledore’s already told the school that. If you didn’t believe him you won’t believe anyone. There is a tense silence.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Well...anyway...uh, I think that in order to learn properly we’1ll need a teacher.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: But we’re all students. None of us has the experience to--

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Someone here does.  68. Everyone looks at her. She is staring directly at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL CORNER
dialogues.text: I for one would like to know why Potter’s qualified and the rest of us aren't.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: (defensively) Well, he’s only confronted You-Know- Who himself four times and lived to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN BONES
dialogues.text: One of the portraits said you'd killed a Basilisk in the Chamber of Secrets with that sword in Dumbledore’s office.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Uh...well, yeah, I did.

dialogues.speaker: LEE JORDAN
dialogues.text: Blimey, Harry... Half the crowd looks awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: LAVANDER BROWN
dialogues.text: Wow...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Can't forget that he saved the Sorcerer’s Stone from You-Know-Who in his first year. The Patil sisters’ eyes are wide with respect and astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: And last year he got through the Triwizard Tournament! There are mutters of agreement.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Not to mention you dueled with You- Know-Who all alone and he still couldn’t kill you!  69.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: And you fought off those dementors that attacked you this summer. Hermione looks tremendously pleased.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: So all in favor of taking lessons from Harry? She holds up her hand. Ron, Ginny, Fred, George, Neville, Luna, Dean, Lee, Katie, Alica, Angelina, and Susan raise their hands. Then, after a moment, the rest raise theirs well.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Where are we going to meet?

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: What about an unused classroom?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That might work. I’1l look into that.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ok, good. She pulls a parchment out of her bag.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I think we should put our names down, so we know who was here. Suddenly people look uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: ERNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know...if it were found...I mean, Umbridge wouldn’t like what we're doing...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Honestly, Ernie, do you think I’d just leave it lying around? Besides, its enchanted. Ernie looks more comfortable. Fred and George eagerly sig as do the rest, even Cho’s friend MARIETTA signs.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Also, what should we call ourselves?  70.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELINA
dialogues.text: What about the Anti-Unbridhe League?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We need something that doesn’t give away what we’re doing.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: I think it should be Dumbledore’s Army. There is excited agreement. Harry smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Dumbledore’s Army it is, then. The D.A. for short. Fred and George stand, along with Lee.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We'll let you know when we’re going to meet. The meeting breaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron, and Hermione trudge back up towards the castl

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I think that went well.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: And did you see Cho, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (stiffly) What about her?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Well, she couldn’t keep her eyes off you, could she?! Harry gives a little smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, carrying a load of schoolbooks, walks alone down a stone hallway. Angelina comes running up to him.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELINA
dialogues.text: Harry, you won't believe...that Umbridge woman...this is too much!!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s she done now?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELINA
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Angelina approach a large BILLBOARD surrounded murmuring students. They push their way through. A large parchment hangs from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: “By order of the Hogwarts High Inquisitor: All student organizations, societies, teams, groups, and clubs are henceforth disbanded. Permission to reform must be approved by High Inquisitor Umbridge. No student organization can exist without the knowledge and approval of the High Inquisitor. Any student found to be a part of an illegal organization will be expelled immediately.” Angelina is furious just looking at it again.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELINA
dialogues.text: She refused to allow us to reform the Gryffindor team. We had to go to Dumbledore to get her to allow it. Harry is extremely angry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Not only that, but what about the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is pacing in front of the fire. Hermione and Ron si chairs, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This isn’t a coincidence. He looks at Ron and Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: She knows.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: She can’t!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look, we don’t know how many people could have overheard our meeting and told her.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Or somebody at the meeting could have blabbed to her.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No, they couldn’t have. The parchment we all signed was enchanted, like I said. No one can betray the D.A. without us knowing. Harry stops pacing and grins at Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What would we do without you, Hermione? She beams at him. Hedwig flutters in the open window and collapses to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hedwig!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: She’s hurt! Hedwig hoots softly.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: She doesn’t look very good.  73.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, you'd better take her to Professor Grubby-Plank. She’1ll know what to do. Harry scoops Hedwig up and runs through the portrait hole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry steps out of the portrait hole. McGonagall comes around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Potter! He stops and turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Where on earth are you going at this time of night?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s Hedwig. I think she’s been attacked.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: What? She steps closer and peers closely at the hurt owl.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Yes, I think you might be right, Potter. She looks at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Where was she coming from?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: London. He gives her a significant look. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Well, give her to me. I’1l run her down to Professor Grubby-Plank. Harry hands Hedwig to her. She takes the owl carefully.  74.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: There you are. She straightens and moves down the hall, then stops. She turns to look at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Bear in mind, Potter, that channels of communication in and out of Hogwarts are being watched, won’t you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Good. Now, off to bed. She vanishes around the corner. Harry turns and goes back through the portrait hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry steps back inside the common room. Hermione and Ron have gone to bed. He is alone.

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: Mr. Harry Potter! Harry turns to see Dobby standing in the middle of the ro

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dobby! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: Dobby is cleaning, sir. He seemed to want to say something more.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What is it, Dobby.

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: Dobby...Dobby wishes he could help Harry Potter. Dobby has heard him muttering in his sleep.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it, Dobby. But I don’t think you can help me. Dobby’s ears droop.  75. Harry collects his books, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Actually, there is something you can do, Dobby. Dobby brightens instantly.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I need a room where twenty-eight people can practice Defense Against the Dark Arts without the teachers knowing. Especially Professor Umbridge. Dobby leaps into the air and claps his hands.

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: Dobby knows of the perfect place, Harry Potter! It is the Room of Requirement, sir. You can only use the room in times of great need. Whatever you need will be there for you, Harry Potter.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That’s brilliant, Dobby! Dobby looks pleased.

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: Dobby can show you now, if you wish, Harry Potter. Harry thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Better not, Dobby. School is pretty intense right now. We'll do it ina few months, before the holidays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We glide over the landscape, the leaves gradually vanishi from the trees and snow begins to drift into sight as we up speed. We sail into the snowstorm over the Hogwarts Grounds, past Hagrid’s empty hut and into the Quidditch stadium.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visibility is low. Players scatter everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: LEE JORDAN
dialogues.text: ..-and Slytherin is up forty to ten. Alica with the quaffle! Alica spins through the blizzard, trying desperately to s Two shapes emerge from the snow. They are CRABBE and GOYL the Slytherin Beaters. Both of them take a swing at her. She twists completely around on her broom and the clubs s harmlessly past. She pushes forward to the Slytherin goal and hurtles the quaffle. Blocked by the Slytherin Keeper! Below, in the stands, there is a groan from the Gryffindo side. From the Slytherins, there is a chant.

dialogues.speaker: SLYTHERINS
dialogues.text: Weasley is our King, Weasley is our King, He always lets the Quaffle in, Weasley is our King! Harry pulls up near to Ron, who is looking grimly sick to stomach.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Just ignore them, Ron! Ron does not acknowledge him. Several Slytherins, in possession of the Quaffle, bear do on the Gryffindor goals. They throw the quaffle. Ron dive and misses. A loud GONG sounds. Another groan from the Gryffindors.

dialogues.speaker: LEE JORDAN
dialogues.text: (v.o.) Another ten points to Slytherin. The score is now fifty-ten in favor of Slytherin. Malfoy pulls up on his broom near Ron as well.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: I should thank you, Weasley. You're definitely our best player! He laughs.  77. Just then, the SNITCH blasts past Malfoy. He takes off in pursuit. Harry rockets after him at top speed, ignoring t bite of the snow against his face. He and Malfoy give chase, following the Snitch at top spe Malfoy is still far closer than Harry. Then the Snitch BANKS SHARPLY. Both Draco and Harry turn it, though now Harry has pulled even with Draco. They are inches from the Snitch. They reach with all of their migh Harry’s hand inches out in front of Draco and closes arou the Snitch. Draco’s fingers scrabble on the back of Harry gloved hand. The crowd goes wild. Harry straightens, triumphant. Behind him, without warning, Crabbe emerges from the bliz and CRACKS Harry across the back of the head with his Beater’s club. Harry slumps forward, and nose-dives into the pitch, roll to a stop looking dazed. There is a groan of sympathy fro the crowd. The other Gryffindors land and run to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry, are you all right? He is helped to his feet by Fred and George.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Bet you loved that, Potter! Saved Weasley’s neck, didn’t you? The Gryffindors ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: I've never seen a worse Keeper! Maybe we should add some more verses to our little song. About his filthy mother! George tries to leap at Draco. Harry and Fred hold him ba

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: And his pathetic loser of a father too! Fred attempts to charge Draco too. Other Gryffindors are restraining them now.  78.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: But then, you like the Weasleys, don’t you? How can you stand the stink? I guess it reminds you of your own dear mother! Harry turns and runs full out at Draco, who looks startle Harry leaps at him, CRUSHING his fist into Draco’s jaw an knocking him to the ground. George breaks free of the Gryffindors and follows, hittin Malfoy too. Harry leaps onto Draco, hitting him again and again.

dialogues.speaker: MADAM HOOCH
dialogues.text: Impedimenta! She blasts Harry and George with her spell, knocking them of Malfoy. McGonagall storms onto the pitch, Gryffindor scarf flappi wildly in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: (shouting) What on earth do you two think you're doing? Harry rolls to his feet and goes for Malfoy again. Madam Hooch stands between them, her wand pointed directly at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HOOCH
dialogues.text: Don’t make me stupify you, Potter! Harry stops, breathing hard, glaring daggers at Malfoy, w is curling in a ball, bleeding and crying. McGonagall comes right up to Harry and grabs him hard by elbow. He finally turns his attention to her. She is pale grim-faced.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: My office. Now. INT. MCGONAGALL’S OFFICE - DAY George and Harry stand in front of McGonagall’s desk. She stands on the other side of it.  79.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: In all my thirty-nine years at this school, I have never seen such a disgusting display.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Malfoy provoked us.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Of course he wanted to provoke you! He‘d just lost! She stares at both of them.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: I cannot express in words the disappointment I feel right now. The door opens and Umbridge steps into the room, smiling sickly.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: What is it, Dolores?

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: I thought you might need some additional authority in dealing with these two.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: You thought wrong. Now kindly remove yourself from my office. She turns back to George and Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Now, I don’t care what Malfoy said. Your performance out there was shameful. Fifty points from Gryffindor, and I’m giving you both a week’s worth of detentions.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: I hardly think that’s an adequate punishment for this. She holds up a parchment.  80.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Educational Decree Twenty-Five. It gives me, as High Inquisitor, the power to give punishments and privileges, and to alter those given out to students by other members of the staff. She turns to Harry and George.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: So, I think a life-long ban from playing quidditch should do the trick for both of these. Oh, and this one’s twin as well. He was going to attack Malfoy as well. Harry and George are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ban us...for life.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Yes, indeed, Mr. Potter. She moves towards them.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Ah, I'll take your brooms as well. She confiscates the brooms too.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Well, have a wonderful day. She sweeps from the office. Harry looks to McGonagall.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You’ve--!

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: My hands are tied, Potter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The atmosphere in the common room is somber. The Gryffind team sits by itself, dejected and depressed.  81.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELINA
dialogues.text: I can’t believe it...three players banned for life in one day...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m going to resign. Harry is slumped low in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You can’t!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I’m horrible! I should never have joined.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: If you quit, we'll be out four players! Ron looks miserable.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: This is the worst day of my life. Hermione is staring out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I know something that could cheer you up.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hermione, give it up.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Hagrid’s back! INT. HAGRID’S HUT - NIGHT Harry, Ron, and Hermione have taken seats around the hut, the table and in chairs. Hagrid boils some water over the fire. His FACE is covere CUTS and BRUISES.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hagrid, what happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: I’ve fine, I tell yeh!  82.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Come off it, Hagrid! We're not blind!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Was it because of the giants? There is a silence.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Can’ answer tha’, I’m afraid. Top secret, that is. Business of the Order.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We know you were looking for giants, Hagrid. Dumbledore said so last year.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, yeah, I was, then. Went with Madame Maxime. Took us a month to get to their camp.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: A month?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: O’ course! Can’ do magic, not with the Ministry followin’ us all the way. Plus, giants aren’t fond o’ wizards. Don’ trust ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So what did you do when you found them?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Waited ‘till mornin’ an’ then marched righ’ in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagrid and Madam Maxime march into the camp, eyes fixed firmly on the GURG. Hagrid holds a large branch of EVERLASTING FIRE above his head. The GURG sits some distance away, sitting on a large ston seat, surrounded by other giant servants. THe giants stare at Hagrid and Maxime, flabbergasted. The slowly move aside for them to pass.  83. Hagrid and Maxime bow before the GURG.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: (v.o.) We gave ‘ema gift, jus’ like Dumbledore said. Gave ‘em a branch o’ Gubraithian fire, Everlasting Flame. (pause) Giants love magic, see, jus’ not too fond o’ wizards. Nuthin’ a giant loves better than magic. The GURG smiles and hoists the branch of fire into the ai The giants roar and yell around them. Sticking the branch into the ground, the Gurg beckons Hag and Maxime foreward.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (v.o.) What happened then?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: (v.o.) We sat down, an’ had a talk. Well, mostly they listened good. But there were good signs. (pause) Well, they did ‘till tha’ night. Tha’s when everythin’ went wrong. Hagrid and Maxime watch a great battle in the valley belo them. They stand on the mountain side.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: (v.o.) There were a coup. Nex’ mornin’ there were a new chief. Hagrid and Maxime walk back towards the New GURG the next day. This GURG is evil-looking and grinning at them nasti

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: (v.o.) We went back ter see what we could do with this new chief. Two large bodyguards block the way to the new Gurg. They Hagrid. Maxime blasts them with spells from her wand. The drop Hagrid.  84. There is an earth-shaking ROAR from all around them. Gian charge them from every direction. Maxime and Hagrid flee back up the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: (v.o.) An’ then things got even worse. Death Eaters arrived, an’ the new chief were all happy ter be seein’ them! Several DEATH EATERS, faces concealed behind their black cloaks, approach the new Gurg, who beckons them to speak.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: (v.o.) We figured, jus’ cause some o’ the giants were favorin’ You-Know-Who don’t mean all of ‘em were. The coup ha’ driven the ol’ chief's supporters into some caves, so we wen’ in after ‘em. Maxime and Hagrid walk into a dark cave, wands glowing.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (awed) You went into caves looking for giants?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: (v.o.) We foun’ enough, an’ they seemed interested--at first. Then the new chief’s lot raided the caves. Tweren’t many survivors, an’ none o’ them wanted anythin’ to do with us after tha’. INT. HAGRID’S HUT - NIGHT There is silence.

dialogues.speaker: ROM
dialogues.text: So...no giants are coming?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Well, not righ’ away. We brought our message, an’ I expec’ a fair few’ll remember it afore teh end comes.  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry strolls into the ROOM OF REQUIREMENT, looking at th assembled group that makes up DUMBLEDORE’S ARMY.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Glad to see all of you could find this place all right.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Hey, Harry, what is all this stuff? Scattered around the room are many devices such as DARK

dialogues.speaker: DETECTORS
dialogues.text: and SNEAKASCOPES.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Loads of Defense Against the Dark Arts equipment. Hopefully we’1ll be able to get to all of it before the end of term. He paces in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You need to understand something before we start, though. Defending yourself from the Dark Arts has less to do with magical ability and more to do with thinking fast and a lot of luck. (pause) We'll be doing Expelliarmus tonight, though hopefully we can move on to other things if we have time.

dialogues.speaker: ZACHARIAS
dialogues.text: Oh please. Professor Lockhart taught us that in second year.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Lockhart didn’t teach as much as prune himself.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Besides, it works. I used it against You-Know-Who last June. It saved my life. Zacharias falls silent.  86.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Right. Well, let’s split into pairs and give it a go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry strolls among the students amid shouts of “Expelliarmus”, checking everyone’s progress. He reaches Neville and Ron, who are practicing together.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Expelliarmus! Ron’s wand flips from his hand across the room.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well done, Neville! He shouts down the others.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look here, you lot! Neville’s really got the hang of this one. (to Neville) Go ahead again. Fred tosses Ron’s wand to him. Neville swirls his wand.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Expelliarmus! Ron’s wand does it again.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: I did it! I did it! Harry claps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Never forget this spell, Neville. It could save your live some day. He moves to the front of the room again.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone. We’ve done a lot today, and I’ve seen some great improvement. That’s it for now. We’1ll meet back here, same time next week!  87. People began to drift out of the meeting. Harry goes abou straightening the room up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry lies in bed. He dreams again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We float along a dark corridor, inches from the floor. We come to another corridor and peer down it. It appears emp A great PYTHON of a SNAKE slithers down the empty corrido It slowly makes its way past many doors, until it reaches last, another, larger door. Behind it, an invisibility cloak falls to the floor ina SHIMMER OF SILVER. Mr. Weasley stands, drawing his wand. He fires a GOLDEN JINX at the snake. He misses. The snake strikes. Mr. Weasley screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry yells at the top of his lungs, eyes tightly closed. makes biting motions with his mouth, snarling madly. A seizure takes him. He screams in rage and horror, his entire bed shaking wit his thrashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snake strikes Mr. Weasley again and again. BLOOD SPLATTERS against the walls and floor. Mr. Weasley scream again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron, Seamus, Dean, and Neville leap out of their beds. Ha screams again, an unearthly sound of horror, anguish, and blood lust. Ron and Neville sprint to Harry’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with him?  88. Harry screams again. His eyes snap open and they are pure white, without pupils. He makes the bitting motion again, thrashing wildly.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Get McGonagall! Go! Neville turns and runs out of the dorms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Weasley sits in her living room drinking a mug of te On the other side of the room stands the WEASLEY’S CLOCK. chimes. She looks up, and then stands, moving closer to i Mr. Weasley’s hand grinds over to the hour labeled “MORAL PERIL.” The mug of tea SHATTERS on the floor. Mrs. Weasley clutches at her mouth in dread and horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snake strikes again. Mr. Weasley, eyes flicking everywhere and seeing nothing, staggers into the wall and falls to the ground, leaving a bloody smear to mark his descent. The snake abandons the door and slithers away at top spee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry still struggles madly.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry! HARRY! Harry blinks, and his eyes are normal. He comes to himsel only to let out a SHRIEK of BURNING AGONY. He clutches at scar, eyes crossing and unable to focus. He rolls off the bed and onto the floor, where he writhes abject pain. Neville returns with McGonagall.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Potter!  89. She runs to him, thrusting her candle into Neville’s hand She falls to her knees next to Harry and tries to touch h Her hand touches his skin and he yelps as if BURNT. She b off. Harry vomits all over the floor. Taking a step back, McGonagall draws her wand, looking uncertain what she wil with it in any case. Then, as suddenly as it had begun, it stops. Harry slumps over, unmoving. McGonagall is at his side in an instant. She rolls him ov His eyes are closed.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Wake up, Potter. Wake up. Please... Harry’s eyes open. He sits up, looking frantic.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Mr. Weasley’s been attacked!

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: You dreamed this, Potter?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, I saw it happen! I...I was there... Ron is looking pale.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: You’re sure this happened, Potter?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (shouting) Yes! We’ve got to do something or he will die!

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: We're going to see the Headmaster, Potter. (pause) Weasley, you’d best come too. INT. DUMBLEDORE’S OFFICE - NIGHT McGonagall opens the door leading to DUMBLEDORE’s OFFICE leads Harry and Ron inside.  90. Dumbledore looks up from where he is seated at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Professor McGonagall, and...ah... Dumbledore does not look at Harry, even acknowledge his presence.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Well, Potter has had some kind of nightmare...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It wasn’t a nightmare! Well, I was asleep, but it wasn’t a normal dream. It was...well, real. I saw, well--Mr. Weasley has been attacked by a giant snake. Ron is looking very pale.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: How did you see this? How were you positioned when you saw it?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh. Uh...I was the snake. I saw it from the snake’s perspective.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Is Arthur seriously injured?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes! Dumbledore stands and looks up at the portraits of previo headmasters and headmistresses of Hogwarts. Two of them a watching the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: You were listening?

dialogues.speaker: EVERARD
dialogues.text: Naturally.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Raise the alarm. We must make sure Arthur is found by the right people.  91. Everard and Dilys move out of their frames and do not ret

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Many of our previous headmasters and mistresses have portraits in other institutions, allowing them to move between them. He motions for all of them to sit. They sit. Dumbledore moves to Fawkes.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Fawkes, we will need a warning. The PHOENIX vanishes in a blast of fire. Dumbledore sits back at his desk and pulls a SILVERY, WHIRRING instrument to him. It emits some smoke that form itself into the shape of a SERPENT, then splits in two. The two serpents coil around each other.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Naturally, naturally. (pause) But in essence divided? Harry and Ron exchange confused looks. Everard returns to his portrait.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: What news?

dialogues.speaker: EVERARD
dialogues.text: I shouted until someone came. They carried him up seconds ago. He doesn’t look good. Covered in blood... Dilys returns to her portrait at this time.

dialogues.speaker: DILYS
dialogues.text: Dumbledore, I’ve just seen them arrive at St. Mungos. Apperated there moments ago. He looks really bad.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Good. (to McGonagall) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUMBLEDORE (cont'd) Minerva, the rest of the Weasleys will need to be awoken. She nods and departs. Dumbledore again turns to the portraits hanging on the wa

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Phineas. PHINEAS BLACK opens his eyes and stares at Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Phineas, I need you to visit your other portrait. Tell Sirius what happened and that we are coming to stay for a while.

dialogues.speaker: PHINEAS
dialogues.text: It’s late, Dumbledore... Dumbledore stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: PHINEAS
dialogues.text: I’m going, I’m going... He vanishes. Dumbledore takes a black pot and taps it with his wand.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: “Portus.” McGonagall returns with Ginny, Fred, and George in tow.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Harry, what's happening--

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Your father has been injured in the course of his work for the Order. He is alive and arrived at St. Mungo’s Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries only moments ago. He picks up the pot and steps around the desk.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: We, however, are going to Sirius’s house until the morning. We're merely waiting for Phineas to return.  93. A flash of flames appears over Fawkes’ perch. A single feather floats to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Fawkes’s warning. Umbridge knows you’re out of bed. Minerva, head her off. Tell her anything you can think of. McGonagall departs again. Phineas returns to his portrait.

dialogues.speaker: PHINEAS
dialogues.text: He says he’d be delighted. Dumbledore beckons everyone over to him.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: We're going by Portkey. They all grab the pot, and VANISH.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GRIMMAULD PLACE
dialogues.text: They reappear in the kitchen of Grimmauld Place. Sirius hurries in.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: There you are. He looks at Dumbledore, but the Headmaster had all ready disapperated.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: We've got to go to St. Mungo’s.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: No, you can’t.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: We can go where we please.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: We can’t go yet. It would look to suspicious if you lot showed up fifteen minutes after Arthur arrives because Harry’s been seeing visions of things happening hundreds of miles from Hogwarts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, livid with rage and fear, shoves his face near Sirius’s.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: That’s our father out there dying!

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: I can’t let you leave. I’m sorry. He slowly draws his wand, holding it loosely at his side. point was not lost to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: You don’t even care! You wouldn't even understand! Sirius stares at him incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: I was part of the first Order. I lost my best friends to You-Know- Who. His eyes flick to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: He’s all I have left of them. Believe me, I don’t want Arthur to die. (pause) But there are some things worth dying for! Fred and George look very much cowed by the haunted look Sirius’s eyes. Finally, they sink into chairs around the table. George p his head in his hands. Fred simply stares at the wall. Gi is weeping softly. Ron puts his arm around her. Harry sits away from them, by himself.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GRIMMAULD PLACE
dialogues.text: Fred and Ginny lay slumped in chairs, dozing. The rest ar sitting silently. The front door opens, and Mrs. Weasley bustles in. Fred a Ginny wake with a start.  95.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Mum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Weasleys get up and hug their mother all at once in t entry hall. Harry gets up and walks wearily out into the hall. He sta back, watching, as the Weasleys are reunited in the hall. Yet Harry is forgotten in the background. He stands apart from them, looking on, an intruder to their grief. Finally they separate.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Your father’s alive. He’s going to make it. There is relief evident on all of their faces. Harry turns and leaves, re-entering the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sets down several plates, then looks at Sirius.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sirius, I-- He stops. Sirius looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: You can tell me, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: When I saw the attack, well, I was the snake.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I felt the fangs like they were mine, saw through the snake’s eyes like they were mine... Sirius looks concerned.  96.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think I might be going mad. There is a horrible silence. Sirius looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Nonsense. You’re just tired. You’ve had a rough night.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But what if there’s a snake inside me?

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: You’ve told Dumbledore this? (off Harry’s nod) Then there’s nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Weasley, Ron, Ginny, Fred, George, Moody, and Tonks up to a run-down storefront with a single mannequin in th display window. Tonks moves right up to the window.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: We're here to see Arthur Weasley. The mannequin beckons to them with its finger. Tonks step into the glass and VANISHES. The rest follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a crowded reception area packed with witches a wizards who have been damaged or injured in the course of their magical lives. Many move around wearing white robes with the insignia of WAND and BONE crossed over each other. Mrs. Weasley marches very determinedly through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: This way, come on! INT. ST. MUNGO’S HALLWAY - DAY Moody and Tonks stop outside the door.  97.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: We'll wait outside at first, Molly. It should be family first. Mrs. Weasley nods and pushes her children through the doo Harry holds back, but she beckons to him.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t be silly, Harry. You too. And she ushered him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are three patients in the ward. Arthur lies in the farthest bed by the window, propped up on several pillows reading the paper.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Hullo, everyone! Mrs. Weasley bends down and kisses Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: How are you, dear?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I am absolutely fine. If they could take the bandages off, I’d walk out of here in a jiffy. He hugs Ginny with his good arm.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: How come they haven't taken them off, then?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Oh, I start bleeding like mad. The snake had some strange poison in it. Keeps the wounds open. But they’1l find a cure, don’t you doubt. George leans in close.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What were you doing when it happened, dad?

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: That’s my own business.  98.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: You were guarding it, weren't you? This weapon thing?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: That’s enough! She looks at Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Moody and Tonks are outside, Arthur. They’d like a word. She looks at her children.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: All of you, out, if you please. They turn and leave. Mr Weasley calls Harry back.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Harry, stay a moment. Harry returns to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I never thanked you properly.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: There’s no need--

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: But there is, Harry. If you hadn’t had your vision, no one would have found me in time. So...thank you. Harry smiles, then departs. INT. ST. MUNGO’S HALLWAY - DAY The door to the ward is closed. Ron is listening with his to the door. They lean close to the doors.

dialogues.speaker: TONKS
dialogues.text: .».-we searched the whole floor, Arthur, but we couldn’t find that snake. Why a snake, anyway?  99.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: He probably sent it as a lookout. See what he’s up against. That’s the closest he’s ever gotten to it. (pause) So, Potter says he saw the whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Yes. You know, Dumbledore seems like he’s been waiting for something like this to happen. When I spoke to him this morning, he seemed very worried about Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MOODY
dialogues.text: He should be. I mean, if You-Know- Who is really possessing him... Moody trails off. INT. ST. MUNGO’S HALLWAY - DAY Harry straightens and looks at the others huddled outside door. They are staring at him in unmistakable fear. Harry looks away from them. There is a silence.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Hullo. They turn.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Professor Lockhart! Lockhart looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Professor? Me? Did I really? Well, I expect I was hopeless at it! He rubs his hands together briskly.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Now, I’1ll expect all of you will be wanting my autograph?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Uh, sure... Just then, a HEALER emerges from a DOUBLE-DOOR nearby.  100.

dialogues.speaker: HEALER
dialogues.text: Ah, there you went, Gildroy. She comes up to them and gently takes his elbow.

dialogues.speaker: HEALER
dialogues.text: He keeps wandering off, handing out autographs, don’t you know? It’s a good sign toward recovering his memory, the poor dear.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry about that, mate. Lockhart peers at him.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKHART
dialogues.text: Have we met?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was my wand that backfired on you.

dialogues.speaker: HEALER
dialogues.text: Was it? What a coincidence! She takes Lockhart back in through the double-doors. Harr Ron, and Hermione follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Healer sits Lockhart down in a chair. There are other apportioned sections of the room.

dialogues.speaker: HEALER
dialogues.text: This is our long-term resident ward, for permanent spell damage. Well, I must go... She bustles away.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LONGBOTTOM
dialogues.text: Come along, Neville. Harry and the others turn.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hey, Neville! Neville turns beet-red, and looks away. His GRANDMOTHER looks at the three of them.  101.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LONGBOTTOM
dialogues.text: Friends of yours, Neville? (pause) Ah, yes, Harry Potter. Good to meet you, finally. And a Weasley. She turns to Hermione

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LONGBOTTOM
dialogues.text: And you must be Miss Granger. Neville’s mentioned you.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Who’re you visiting, Neville? Mrs. Longbottom turns to Neville.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LONGBOTTOM
dialogues.text: You haven’t told them?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Told us what?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LONGBOTTOM
dialogues.text: Neville’s dear parents were tortured into insanity by You-Know- Who before he disappeared. Aurors, you know, very well respected. Just then, ALICE LONGBOTTOM, Neville’s mother, emerges fr behind the parition. She beckons tentatively to Neville, who goes to her. She gently, almost reverently, hands him a CANDY WRAPPER.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. LONGBOTTOM
dialogues.text: Another one, Alice? All right, come on, Neville. Neville is still staring at his mother, who smiles at him then disappears again. Neville turns, locks eyes with Harry, and departs. As he goes, he slips the wrapper into his pocket, as if it were most treasured possession. Hermione and Ron watch him.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I never knew...Poor Neville.  102.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GRIMMAULD PLACE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Weasley, Harry, Ginny, Ron, Fred, George, Hermione, Moody, and Tonks walk into the entry hall of Grimmauld Pl Mrs. Weasley looks at Harry concernedly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Harry dear? You look like you’re going to be sick. He doesn’t answer, but marches up the stairs and shuts himself in his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry begins to pack his trunk determinedly.

dialogues.speaker: PHINEAS
dialogues.text: Running away, are we? He turns to the portrait of Phineas.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I have to.

dialogues.speaker: PHINEAS
dialogues.text: You know, I thought Gryffindors had to be brave.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I won’t hurt anybody else.

dialogues.speaker: PHINEAS
dialogues.text: I see. You are running away out of nobility. You know, that’s why I hated teaching. Young people always think they know what’s best, as if no one else could possibly understand things better. Harry moves to a window and opens it, leaning out.

dialogues.speaker: PHINEAS
dialogues.text: I’ve brought a message from Dumbledore. Harry stops and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What is it?  103.

dialogues.speaker: PHINEAS
dialogues.text: Dumbledore says, ‘Stay where you are.’

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That’s it? Stay there while the grown-ups sort things out?

dialogues.speaker: PHINEAS
dialogues.text: When in all your life has listening to Dumbledore ever led you into trouble? Whatever his reasons, he has your best interests at heart, Potter. Phineas moves off the portrait frame and vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fine! Go! And tell Dumbledore thanks for nothing! He tips his trunk over in anger and sits down on the bed. There is a knock on the door. Ginny walks in, looking determined.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ginny, I’m dangerous. You can’t be around me.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Did you forget that I’ve been possessed by You-Know-Who before? Harry falls silent, looking cowed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Lucky you. Anyway, that’s what I wanted to talk to you about. (pause) Can you remember everything you’ve done this year? There aren't any blank spots in your memory?  104.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Then You-Know-Who has never possessed you, Harry. She sits down on the bed next to him.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: I don’t know what’s going on with you right now, but possession’s not one of them. You’re not dangerous. She smiles at him. Finally, he smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Thanks, Ginny.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: Don’t mention it. She hops off the bed and departs the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry wanders into the kitchen and opens the REFRIGERATOR Sirius enters.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Harry, have you seen Kreacher? I haven’t seen him for days now.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Haven’t seen him.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Oh well. Maybe he’s crawled up into the air ducts and died...mustn’t get my hopes up though. The back door is shoved open and Snape enters.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Potter, excellent. I’d like a word. He marches over to the table and sits.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Sit, Potter.  105.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: You know, I don’t like people giving orders in my house.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: How unfortunate for you. Now kindly get out. My instructions from Dumbledore are to talk with Potter alone.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: I’m his godfather. I think I’11l stay. Snape curls his lip in anger but keeps quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Very well, then. I know how you like to pretend you’re useful. Sirius stiffens, but ignores the jab.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: It is the Headmaster’s wish that I teach you Occlumency, Potter.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s that? Snape sneers.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Occlumency. It is an ancient form of magic that allows you to defend your mind from external intrusion. (pause) We begin at six-o-clock on Monday, Potter. Snape stands.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Well, unlike Sirius here, I don’t have unlimited leisure time.

dialogues.speaker: SIRUS
dialogues.text: Just a second, Snape. If I hear that you’re using this to give Harry a hard time, you’1l have me to answer to. Snape sneers again.  106.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: How touching. Yet Potter is incredibly like his father. Criticism simply bounces off of him. Sirius stands and grabs Snape by the shoulders and roughl shoves him into the wall. He glares at Snape.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: I’ve warned you, Snivellus. Dumbledore may think you’ve reformed, but I know better... Snape pushes him out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Touch me one more time, Black, and you won’t touch anything again. He sweeps back to the door and departs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sail through another snowstorm back to Hogwarts, passi the grounds and sliding through an open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry makes his way along the hallway. Suddenly Cho comes around the corner. She skids to an abr halt, blushing slightly.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Hi, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hi. There is an awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Er...bye then. She starts to walk by.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey Cho! She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh, Valentine’s Day is the same day as our next Hogsmead visit. She blushes harder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, uh, would you like to, you know, go with me?

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Sure!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Cool. She smiles at him and walks away. INT. SNAPE’S OFFICE - DAY Harry enters SNAPE’S OFFICE. Snape sits behind his to a PENSIVE.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Sit, Potter. Harry does so.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: As you are well aware, I will be teaching you Occlumency. The headmaster feels you should learn this form of magic to defend yourself against the Dark Lord, who is skilled at Legilimency.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s that, Professor?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Legilimency is the ability to extract thoughts and feelings from others.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Voldemort can read minds?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: As usual, you have all the subtlety of a stone wall, Potter. (MORE)
desk, next  108. SNAPE (cont'd) The mind is not a book, of which any page can be examined. The mind is complex and multi-layered.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So he could read our minds right now?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Eye contact is normally required for Legilimency to work. In your case, however, things are somewhat different. Your scar has forged a connection between you and the Dark Lord. (pause) When your mind is most relaxed, such as during sleep, you receive the Dark Lord’s thoughts and feelings. The Headmaster believes that it is inadvisable for this to continue.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But hasn’t it helped so far? I mean, it saved Mr. Weasley’s life, didn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Yes, it did, but at the expense of our advantage. The connection between you was so powerful during your vision of the snake that the Dark Lord became aware of it. The Headmaster fears that he may try to use this to his advantage, to Manipulate you through false visions. Snape stands and pulls out his wand. Harry flinches, ever slightly. But Snape merely puts it to his head and draws GLOWING STRING of memory from his head and drops it into

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Wand out, Potter. Harry draws his wand.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You may use any spell you can think of to try and repel me.  109.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I am going to break into your mind. (pause) Legimens! The spell hits Harry, who staggers backward, grimacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry clings to a tree branch as the dog RIPPER barks at from the ground. The Dursleys laugh as they stand in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits under the SORTING HAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stands over Sirius, a PATRONUS hovering over him as hundreds of DEMENTORS swarm overhead. INT. SNAPE’S OFFICE - DAY Harry’s face is contorted with rage.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No! A spell fires from his wand. Snape dodges it. Gasping, Ha falls to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Well, you stopped me eventually. Ideally, you should repel me with your mind. Harry climbs to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Clear your mind, Potter. Abandon your emotions. Legilimens! Harry staggers again.  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Vernon nails the letterbox closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry skids to a stop and looks down a dark hallway. Mr. Weasley stops as well, and glances back at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Come on, Harry!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I've been there before... Mr. WEASLEY looks nervous, then grabs Harry's robes and d him along.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Now, Harry, I find that highly unlikely... INT. SNAPE’S OFFICE - DAY Snape lowers his wand, breaking the spell.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: What was that? Harry looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’ve just realized... Snape is staring at him, agitated.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Realized what, Potter? Harry looks at Snape suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s in the Department of Mysteries, sir? There is a stunned silence. Snape regards Harry with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: What did you say?  111.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That corridor, I’ve been dreaming about it for months...it leads to the Department of Mysteries, I’m sure of it. Snape comes around the desk. He is deathly quiet, always bad sign.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: There are many things in the Department of Mysteries, Potter, none of which concern you. There is a horrifying SCREAM that ECHOS through the castl Snape and Harry stare at the ceiling. Snape glances at Ha then hefts his wand and sweeps from the office. Harry follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a huge crowd of students standing at the top of stairs leading down into the entry hall. There is another UNEARTHLY WAIL. Harry pushes his way through the crowd until he can see. Trelawney stands at the bottom of the stairs, looking cra and turning in circles, her wand out and clutched in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: (shrieking) You cannot sack me!

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: I can do whatever I wish!

dialogues.speaker: TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: This is my home! Umbridge is grinning evilly.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Not anymore. She points at the door with a stubby finger.  112.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Now remove yourself from this castle!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: She will not be leaving. Behind Umbridge, the crowd parts slowly, and Dumbledore m down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: I have the authority, Headmaster!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Oh, I agree with you, Professor Umbridge. You do have the power to dismiss my teachers. However... He looks at Trelawney, who stands alone in the entry hall smiling at Dumbledore through her tears.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: ...You cannot send them from this castle. That is still my decision. Professor Trelawney will remain here. Umbridge turns to him, furious.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: And what of her quarters when I appoint a new teacher.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Happily, that will not be necessary. I have found a successor for good Professor Trelawney already. As you know... Umbridge is looking mutinous.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: ...the Ministry can only appoint new teachers if I cannot find one. I think you will find him suitable enough. The GREAT OAKEN doors leading to the grounds swing open, revealing an EBONY-SKINNED CENTAUR. It is FIRENZE, who sa Harry in his first year.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: This is Firenze.  113. Umbridge is thunderstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are huddled around a table.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: So you're saying this weapon You- Know-Who’s after is in the Department of Mysteries?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s got to be.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: That’s got to be what Surgis Podmore was doing in the Ministry when he was arrested.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Probably. Mr. Weasley was probably there when he was attacked, too. That must be what the Order’s guarding!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: But why the Department of Mysteries?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It makes perfect sense, Ron. It’s got to be something the Ministry’s been developing. Something top secret. Harry nods in agreement. Hermione picks up a copy of the Daily Prophet grimly.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Look at this. There’s been a mass escape from Azkaban.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Bloody hell! Harry stares at the front page picture of ten witches and wizards.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: They’re all Death Eaters!  114. Hermione nods fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Yes. Harry grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Voldemort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over Hogwarts as Harry, Ron, and Hermione stroll down the main street of Hogsmead. Cho quickly finds Harry.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Hi, Harry! Harry grins sheepishly at her, avoiding looking at Ron.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Have fun, Harry. Meet me in The Three Broomsticks after. There’s something you need to do.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ok. He goes to Cho, and they leave together. INT. MADAM PUDDIFOOT’S - DAY Outside, it rains. Harry and Cho sit awkwardly opposite each other at a smal table. Valentine’s Day decorations accost the eyes at eve turn.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: You know, Cedric and I came here last year. Before... Harry looks away, and sees several couples kissing. He lo away.  115.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: I--I’ve been meaning to ask you for ages...but...I mean... Harry looks at her. She is beginning to tear up.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Did--did Cedric say anything about me before he...he--died?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh. Uh, no, there wasn’t really much time... Cho bursts into tears. Harry tries to console her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look, maybe we should talk about something else...

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: I thought you’d want to talk about it! I thought you’d understand! She stands up so suddenly the table rattles. The teashop gone deathly still. Everyone watches them.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: See you around, Harry. She walks out. Harry stands and runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry staggers into the rain, looking around frantically. Cho has disappeared. Getting wetter by the minute, he gives up and slowly make his way over to the Three Broomsticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters and sees Hermione. She’s sitting in a booth wit Luna and RITA SKEETER, a reporter. Harry sits down.  116.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s this all about?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: That’s what Little Miss Perfect was about to tell us. Harry glances at Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Right, well, I figured that with all of the negative press out about Harry, he should have a chance to defend himself. (pause) All of the details. What happened last summer. The truth about Sirius Black and Voldemort, not to mention the names of all the Death Eaters still on the loose. Rita leans across the table.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: The Prophet will never publish that. Goes against the public mood.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Well, it doesn’t matter. We’ve found a publisher for the article.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Who? Luna looks away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: LUNA
dialogues.text: My father. He’s the editor of The Quibbler. Rita laughs out loud.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: The Quibbler? (to Hermione) You think people will take Harry Potter seriously if he’s published in the Quibbler? It’s nothing but a conspiracy theory, cock-and-bull story tabloid!  117.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Some won't believe Harry, that’s true. But every person we do convince is one more ally. Rita shrugs, and pulls her quill from her bag.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: So, Harry. Ready to tell the public the truth?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess so. Hermione sits back and sips her drink.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Fire away, Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow on the ground has melted. The sky is clear and t sun shines brightly. Spring has come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron and Hermione sit at the Gryffindor table eatin breakfast. An owl drops a letter on Harry’s plate. Hermione opens it pulls out a copy of the Quibbler. Harry’s smiling face grins at them from the front cover.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Look, Harry! It’s your article! Then, a dozen more owls drop letters on Harry. He covers head as their rain around him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What on earth? Hermione beams at him.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Fan mail, Harry! Responses to the article.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Which article is that, dear?  118. Umbridge had appeared at their table, smiling toad-like.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I have just published an article telling the real story about what happened last June. Umbridge instantly turns an ugly shade of purple in her r

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Where is this article? Hermione hands her the Quibbler.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Right, I will confiscate this. Anyone found in possession of this magazine will be expelled. She stalks off. Hermione giggles in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: She’s done it to herself. Banning the article will only make people want to read it more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stands before the D.A. again.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We've been doing so well, I thought we'd work on some defensive blocking spells tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wands wave and spells fly through the air. Harry paces through the students.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That was really good. With a CRACK, Dobby appears.  119.

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: Mr. Harry Potter! He looks absolutely frantic. Harry turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What is it, Dobby? The House-Elf has gone quiet, clamping his hands over his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: She-- He stopped, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who, Dobby? Dobby shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Is it Umbridge? Dobby nods. Harry looks up, horrified. Dobby forces his arms down and takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: DOBBY
dialogues.text: She knows, Harry Potter. She’s coming! Harry opens the door with a wave of his wand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Get out of here! Now! There is a mad rush to the door. Harry ushers them all ou safely, and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry pelts up a hallway. He is hit in the back with a spell and falls to the groun Malfoy leaps from behind a statue.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Got you, Potter. (pause) Over here, Professor! I've got one!  120. Umbridge hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: It’s him. Well done, Draco! (to Harry) On your feet, Potter. We’re going to see the Headmaster! She turns to Draco.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Search everywhere for the others, Draco. Round them all up. Check everywhere, bathrooms, the library, empty classrooms. We must find them! Draco nods and hurries off. INT. DUMBLEDORE’S OFFICE - NIGHT Umbridge shoves Harry into Dumbledore’s office, which is filled with people. McGonagall, Cornelius Fudge, Kingsley Shacklebolt, another Auror, and Percy Weasley.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: You may be High Inquisitor of this school, Professor Umbridge, but kindly do not manhandle my students. Fudge looks pleased. He claps his hands and rubs them excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Well, well, well, Mr. Potter! I expect you know why you’re here? Harry glances at Dumbledore. The Headmaster shakes his he ever so slightly.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Not really, no.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: You don’t? You haven’t broken any school rules?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: School rules? No.  121.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Or Ministerial Decrees?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Not that I know of. Umbridge opens the door again, leading Marietta, Cho's friend, into the room. She has been crying, and her face covered in PIMPLES forming the word “SNEAK.”

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: I’m afraid the poor girl is unable to speak. But I shall tell you what has transpired. (pause) Shortly after dinner she came to me and said that if I went to the Room of Requirement I would find an illegally-formed student group. (pause) It was at that time that this hex took affect. She gestures to Marietta’s face.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Since I had received information some time ago that Potter and a number of other students had met in the Hog’s Head to start an illegal group--—

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I’m not sure that’s true, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: In point of fact, when young Potter met those students it was not illegal.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: But two days later, Educational Decree Twenty-Four was introduced.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Again, quite correct. However, I wonder if you have any evidence that proves this group has been meeting since then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a witness right here!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Correct again. I must confess that I was, however, under the impression that this young girl only told you a meeting was going on tonight.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Let’s ask her, shall we? She turns to Marietta, who is staring at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: You can shake your head for an answer, dear. Now, have there been more meetings? 122. Slowly, still staring at the wall, Marietta shakes her he

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: What do you mean by shaking your head, girl?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I would think that she was saying there have been no other meetings. Would that be correct? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: But what about Potter? He was the leader, and has been-- To Umbridge’s astonishment, Marietta is shaking her again.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Why are you shaking your head, girl?

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: It usually means ‘no,’ Dolores. Umbridge grabs Marietta by the cloak and shakes her Dumbledore stands, and there is anger in his voice. his wand and points it at Umbridge. head yet roughly. He draws  123.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Again, I cannot have you manhandling my students, Professor Umbridge. She laughs, softly, and lets Marietta go.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: My apologies, Headmaster. I forgot myself.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Well, what about the meeting tonight?

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Right. Of course. Well, we proceeded down to the Room and entered. (pause) We caught Potter just outside. But it doesn’t matter. We’ve found all of their names. She pulls the roster list Hermione had made up from her pocket. Harry gaps at it in horror. Fudge gapes at it as well. He snatches it out of Umbridge hands. He looks up, an expression of twisted delight on h face.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: So, Dumbledore, you’ve been behind this whole thing. He hands the paper to Dumbledore, who looks at it. He see suddenly at a loss for words.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: (harsh whisper) Dumbledore’s Army. Dumbledore smiles pleasantly and spreads his hands widely

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Well, Minister. You’ve caught me.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: This has all been your doing! You’ve been recruiting students for your army!  124.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Quite correct, Cornelius.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: I knew it! I KNEW it! You’ve been plotting against me all this time!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: This is too good to be true! Harry turns to Dumbledore in horror.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Professor, no!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Quiet, Harry!

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Yes, shut up, Potter. So, you’ll be coming with us to the Ministry--

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Ah, yes. I was wondering when we'd hit that little snag.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: I see no snag, Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: But I do. You seem to be laboring under the delusion that I would ‘come quietly.’

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Resisting arrest, now are you, Dumbledore?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Precisely. You see, I have absolutely no intention of going to Azkaban. The Auror next to Kingsley slowly moves his hand towards pocket.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Don’t be silly, Hawkes. Leave the wand there.  125. The man stops.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: You would really take on two Aurors, Dolores, and myself, Dumbledore?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Naturally. All of you did rather well on your spellwork at this school, but if you attempt to take me in by force, I’m afraid I shall have to hurt you. In one motion, all of them draw their wands. Harry dives cover. Dumbledore is fastest. There is an instant of BLINDING LI as spells blast in all directions. A spell strikes Dumbledore’s desk with a BANG, and explodes. Dust fills t room. There is a shout and some SCUFFLING OF FEET, another BANG and silence. Harry blinks and stands as the dust settles. Dumbledore hasn’t moved. Fudge, the Auror, Dolores, Kingsley, and Pe are all laying on the floor, unconscious. Dumbledore’s desk has been broken in half, and all of the tables overturned. He moves swiftly to McGonagall, Harry, and Marietta.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Are you all right? McGonagall is standing, dusting herself off.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Yes, we’re fine. (pause) Oh, where will you go, Albus?

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I’m not going into hiding. Fudge will soon regret removing me from Hogwarts. Harry moves to Dumbledore’s side.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, Professor!  126. Dumbledore smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: It’s fine. Now listen to me, Harry. Keep studying Occlumency! Do everything Professor Snape tells you. He grips Harry’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Close your mind! You will understand, in time. Fudge is stirring.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Lay back down. They must not think we have had time to talk. They do so. He moves to Fawkes. Fudge opens his eyes. Dumbledore grabs onto Fawkes’ tail, the two VANISH in a BLAST of FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: FUDGE
dialogues.text: Find him! Umbridge, Percy, Kingsley, the auror, and Fudge race from office. McGonagall ushers Harry and Marietta out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits next to Ron and Hermione. Umbridge stands up from the staff table, holding a parchm

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: “By Order of the Ministry of Magic: Dolores Jane Umbridge will replace Albus Dumbledore as Head of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.” She looks over them all smugly.  127.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: My first act as your new Headmistress is to form an Inquisitional Squad, lead by Draco Malfoy. They will report directly to me about the goings on in the halls of this school. Harry glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Furthermore, our good caretaker, Mr. Filch has requested we reinstate the ‘old punishments.’ I have decided that there is no reason we shouldn't. Filch stands at the back of the hall, grinning like a kid Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Hermione, and Ron head towards the Hogwarts Ground Ron is dressed in his Quidditch robes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Are you sure you can’t? Hagrid said it was important.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No way. Quidditch practice. If I don’t show up, Angelina’1ll go mad. They part ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Hermione, and Hagrid march through the FORBIDDEN FOREST.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Hagrid...we’ve been walking for a good hour.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Its jus’ up ahead, here.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Could you tell us what it is, Hagrid, please?  128.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: All righ’. Well, I’m showin’ yeh this, because tha’ Umbridge woman put me on probation. I can’ last much longer afore I get sacked like Trelawney.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We won’t let her!

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
