dialogues.text: Bah. S’not the end o’ the world. If I do, I’ll go help Dumbledore. Grea’ man... (pause) Anyway, I woudn’ tell yeh ‘cept for tha’. I can’ leave withou’ makin’ arraingmen’s, see? (pause) I’‘ll need all o’ yer help.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Of course we’ll help. Hagrid took a great sniff and clapped her on the back, causing her to stumble slightly.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Knew yeh’d say yes! He pauses and glances at them.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Okay, real quiet like from here on. They creep down the path until Hagrid straightens and smi

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: There we are! There is a huge body laying on the ground before them. It a giant.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Hagrid, I thought none of them wanted to come! Hagrid looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: None o’ them did, Hermione! I didn’ have much ruddy choice inna matter! I couldn’ leave ‘im!  129.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Oh, why, Hagrid? Why?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: He’s me brother! There is a silence in the forest.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Well, half-brother anyway. Me mum had ‘im afore she died. (pause) I though’ I could bring ‘im back here an’ train ‘im up a bit. Teach ‘im a bit o’ manners. Hermione is distraught. Harry is nervous. Hagrid moves towards his half-brother.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Here. I’1l introduce yeh to Grawp! He tosses a rock at GRAWP. It bounces off his head. The g awakes, and slowly stands to his full FIFTEEN-FOOT height

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Yeh all righ’, Grawp? Grawp gives a low roar.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Look wha’ I brough’ yeh, Grawpy! Two new friends an’ all. We ‘ave Harry Potter here, see? An’ over here is Hermy. Grawp stops roaring and simply looks at them. Then he rea out towards Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: GRAWP
dialogues.text: Hermy! Harry grabs her and pulls her behind a tree as the huge f close around the air. Hagrid hits Grawp with a large stic

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Bad Grawpy! Bad boy! Grawp roars in pain.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: We don’ attack our friends, Grawpy!  Grawp roars again. Hagrid, Hermione, and Harry flee the scene.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: See, he don’ know any better. Harry glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Anyway, all yeh need teh do is go an’ talk to ‘im. Give ‘ima bit o’ company. 130. Suddenly Hagrid stops and looks around. From the undergro a large number of CENTAURS have appeared.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Oh blimey... BANE steps into the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: BANE
dialogues.text: I thought we told you that you were no longer welcome in this place, Hagrid. You or that beast you brought from afar.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: S’not up to you who comes and goes in this forest.

dialogues.speaker: BANE
dialogues.text: You stopped us from invoking our punishments on Firenze for becoming the servant of the humans at Hogwarts.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Stopped yeh from committin’ murder, yeh mean!

dialogues.speaker: BANE
dialogues.text: Our ways are not yours, Hagrid. And now you bring that monster here...our patience with it wanes swiftly.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Well, you’1l tolerate ‘im as long as he’s here! The Centaurs paw the ground in agitation.  131.

dialogues.speaker: BANE
dialogues.text: We allow you to pass this time, Hagrid, because you have young with you. But the next time you enter this forest, your life is forfeit. The centaurs vanish into the undergrowth again. INT. MCGONAGALL’S OFFICE - DAY Harry enters McGonagall’s office. She sits behind her des Umbridge sits in the corner with a note pad.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Please sit, Potter. He sits.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: You’re here to have a talk with me about your career thoughts, Potter. We do this so we can begin to aim your courses over the next two years to prepare you for that career.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Well, I did think about being an Auror.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Auror. Interesting, Potter. You’1l need top grades for that. Challenging career path, but not unrewarding.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Hem hem.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Now then, Potter, you’1ll need to concentrate on Defense Against the Dark Arts, Potions, Transfiguration, and Charms to adequately prepare yourself for the general Auror requirements.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Hem hem.  132.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: May I offer you a cough drop, Professor Umbridge?

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Oh, no thank you, Minerva. Actually, I was just wondering if Potter has the proper temperament to be an Auror.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Were you indeed. She turns back to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: If you’re serious in this ambition, Potter, I would recommend concentrating on bringing your Potions and Charms grades up before your O.W.L.s. I daresay you’ve got enough time if you apply yourself. Lord knows you’ve consistently done well in Defense Against the Dark Arts. Professor Lupin--

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Minerva, but have you seen my note on Potter’s current grades in my class?

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Yes, indeed I have.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Then I think you will find that Potter’s grades have been consistently poor this year.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: You apparently misunderstand me. I meant that Potter has done well in every Defense Against the Dark Arts class taught by a competent teacher. She turns briskly back to Harry. Umbridge looks as though cannot believe her ears, then flips a page on her notepad scribbles furiously.  133.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Now, assuming you’ve passed all of your necessary classes, the Ministry will put you through a number of character and aptitude tests.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’s involved in them?

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: How you stand up under pressure, your perseverance, and dedication, things of this nature. Umbridge stands abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: UMBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Harry Potter has no chance of ever becoming an Auror! McGonagall stands as well, her eyes locked with Harry's.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: I will assist you in becoming an Auror if it the very last thing I do, Potter! I will coach you nightly in order to get the necessary grades! Umbridege storms from the room.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: This concludes our meeting, Potter. She smiles at him. He smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: You're welcome, Potter. Now hurry or you'll be late for Occlumency. INT. SNAPE’S OFFICE - DAY Harry sits down in front of Snape’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Have you been practicing, Potter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Well, we shall see, won’t we? 134. He places his wand-tip to his head and extracts that same memory and places it in the pensive. Just then, the door opens and Draco Malfoy steps in.

dialogues.speaker: MALFOY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Professor. Professor Umbridge says she needs you right away.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: What on earth for?

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Well, sir, remember when Montegue vanished over Christmas? She says he’s turned up in a toilet on the fourth floor.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Any idea how he got there?

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: He’s pretty confused, but I think he said something about the Vanishing Closet. Snape stands irritably.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: We will pick your remedial potions lesson up tomorrow, Potter. Draco sniggers. They depart. Harry looks around for a moment, then stands and looks the pensive. He looks at the door. There is silence. He plunges his into the pensive, and his body is sucked into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stands next to the GREAT LAKE. Under a tree sits young Sirius. Next to him are the equally young Lupin, PETIGREW, and lastly JAMES POTTER. into head

dialogues.text: James again. James Lupin James is playing with a Snitch, letting it go and

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: I’m bored. Wish it was full moon. snorts.

dialogues.speaker: LUPIN
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say. nudges Sirius. Sirius grins.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: This should cheer you up, Sirius. Look.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Excellent! Snivellus! 135. catching it Snape is walking by. The four of them stand and follow hi

dialogues.text: All right, there, Snivellus? Snape turns in a flash, wand out. Sirius is faster, howev Snape’s wand flies from his hand. He dives for it.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Expelliarmus!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Impedimenta! Snape stops moving, struggling against INVISIBLE ROPES.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You just wait... Sirius laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Wait for what, Snivellus? You to wipe that great greasy nose on us?  136. Several bystanders laugh. James raises his wand, turning to the bystanders.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: And now, the moment you’ve all been waiting for--

dialogues.speaker: LILY EVENS
dialogues.text: Leave him alone, James Potter! James turns. Harry does as well. It is LILY EVANS. Harry’ mother.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Another charity case, Lily?

dialogues.speaker: LILY EVENS
dialogues.text: What has he done to you?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Nothing. It’s more the fact that he exists, you see... The IMPEDIMENT CURSE wears off. Snape grabs his wand and turns. James whirls.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Semper--—

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Levicorpus! Snape was lifted into the air and dangled by an ankle. He struggled madly, his robe hanging from his arms and over head.

dialogues.speaker: LILY EVENS
dialogues.text: Leave him alone, Potter! James turns and smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I will if you go out with me.

dialogues.speaker: LILY EVENS
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t go out with you if it were a choice between you and the giant squid! Now let him down. James shrugs and gestures with his wand. Snape falls to t ground. He tries to go for his wand again, but Sirius hex him.  137.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS
dialogues.text: Locomotor mortis! Lily draws her wand.

dialogues.speaker: LILY EVENS
dialogues.text: I said, leave him alone! James slowly turns to regard her. The playful expression his face has vanished.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Don’t make me hex you, Lily.

dialogues.speaker: LILY EVENS
dialogues.text: Then let him go!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Fine! He mutters the counter-curse and Snape struggles to his f again.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You’re lucky Lily was here, Snivellus!

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I don’t need help from a mud-blood like her! James eyes are BLAZING with anger. He points his wand, wh is shaking in his hand from his rage, at Snape.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Apologize to her! Now!

dialogues.speaker: LILY EVENS
dialogues.text: Don’t make him apologize. Honestly, you’re as bad as he is! James whirls on her.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I would never call you that. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: LILY EVENS
dialogues.text: You make me sick, Potter. She turns and walks away.  138.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Lily! Hey Lily! Harry watches her go. The adult Snape grabs Harry’s arm roughly. Harry turns to him, horrified. Snape yanks on th arm and the memory dissolves around them. INT. dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Having fun, Potter? Harry shakes his head, but Snape shakes him roughly, fury etched in his every feature.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Been enjoying yourself?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Amusing man, your father... His lips are shaking, his teeth bared. He shakes Harry ag absolutely SEETHING.

dialogues.text: I--sorry! Snape picks Harry up off the floor and FLINGS him away fr him. Harry slams into a potions cabinet and falls to the ground as glass beakers and bottles shatter around him. Snape points a shaking finger at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You will repeat what you saw to no one! Harry is already shaking his head.  139.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, of course not! Snape picks up a jar of some fluid and hurtles it across office. It shatters into the wall. Snape grabs Harry by the robe and hauls him to his feet, shoving him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You had better not, Potter, or you will experience a pain so horrible you will wish you had never been born! He pushes Harry away from him.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Now get out of my sight! Do not set foot in this office ever again! Harry turns and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Today begins your O.W.L exams. A number of Ministry instructors are here to give them. Exams will take place for the next two weeks. dialogues.text: They’re heading for Hagrid’s! Ron and Harry exchange nervous glances.

dialogues.text: The RED-COLORED spells simply impact with Hagrid and boun off of him.

dialogues.text: Look! Harry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: McGonagall’‘1l sort this out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She marches towards them. Her face is illuminated every f moments by the red light of spells being fired.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: (shouting in rage) How dare you! How DARE you! She breaks into a run.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Stop this immediately!  142. The firing continues.

dialogues.speaker: MCGONAGALL
dialogues.text: Enough! She draws her wand in a swift motion. Instantly, four of attackers turn to her and fire their spells. Before she can even react, they slam into her. She is bri illuminated in blood-red light and then is lifted from he feet and hurled backward five feet to slam into the groun She does not move.

dialogues.text: Before we begin, I have an update on Professor McGonagall. She will be all right, and is resting in the hospital wing. Harry and Ron look encouraged.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS

dialogues.speaker: VOLDEMORT

dialogues.text: Are you all right, Potter? Harry shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR MARCHBANKS
dialogues.text: Pressure of exams. It happens. Take a breath, and maybe you'll be ready to go back in. Time is nearly up, but-- Harry is shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I just saw it. He looks out at the Hogwarts grounds, then turns back to them.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How’re we going to get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the Department of Mysteries?

dialogues.text: We've got to do something! Ron and Hermione exchange looks.

dialogues.text: Yeah. They can’t just waltz into the Ministry of Magic!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I won’t let Sirius die! 146. Just then Ginny, Luna, Fred, and George round the corner.

dialogues.text: We heard Harry yelling. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Voldemort’s broken into the Department of Mysteries. He’s got Sirius there! (pause) He could already have the weapon!

dialogues.text: Think, Harry! Voldemort knows you! He knows you’d rush off to save Sirius.
